Forrester","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604047311.jpg?strip=all&w=459":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn56@2020_3/2020/08/25/16-46-58-542_e32237a27c03b454.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Courtois.png?strip=all&w=766":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn32@2020_6/2020/08/25/16-47-13-128_58238e6ca178f55e.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604045282.jpg?strip=all&w=433":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn28@2020_2/2020/08/25/16-47-10-923_0acdd3382a529fe1.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604045292.jpg?strip=all&w=455":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn79@2020_1/2020/08/25/16-47-05-232_41dc528b77fc0847.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/AD-SPORT-GRAPHIC-Chelsea-Top-Fixtures.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn36@2020_5/2020/08/25/16-47-05-954_8423afaf26032555.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598374016688},{"createdTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"Dyson announces TWO new styling attachments to use with their legendary Airwrap – here’s what they do","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/fabulous/12495164/dyson-announces-two-new-styling-attachments-to-use-with-their-legendary-airwrap-heres-what-they-do/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>DYSON have announced two new styling attachments for their super popular Airwrap. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>The new attachments include an additional barrel and brush to allow users to tailor the tool to suit their hair type and desired style. </p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496448\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/671-Airwrap-20mm-Barrel-Attachment-In-Use_June-2020_Image.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496448\" width=\"960\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Dyson</figcredit></figure>The new attachments are available now. [/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>The two new attachments will set you back £30, and are designed to work with the Dyson Airwrap.</p>\n\n\n\n<ul><li><strong>Dyson Airwrap Styler Attachments, £30 &#8211; <a href=\"https://www.dyson.co.uk/hair-care/dyson-airwrap-accessories.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\">buy here</a></strong></li></ul>\n\n\n\n<p>The Dyson Airwrap itself costs £449.99 and is available from <a href=\"https://www.dyson.co.uk/hair-care/dyson-airwrap-accessories.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\">dyson.co.uk</a>. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>As you may or may not know, it looks to style your hair with no extreme heat, and does so to curl and wave hair from wet to dry, as well as brushes smooth. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Dyson&#8217;s two new barrels take two or it&#8217;s most popular styles and adapt them slightly for updates on bouncy blow dries and must have curls. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Available now from <a href=\"https://www.dyson.co.uk/hair-care/dyson-airwrap-accessories.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\">dyson.co.uk</a>, they&#8217;ll cost shoppers £30 and include a 20mm Barrels and a small round Voluminising Brush, but what does each do?</p>\n\n\n\n<h2>20mm Barrel Attachment</h2>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496902\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604060292.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496902\" width=\"960\" height=\"956\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Dyson</figcredit></figure>The 20mm barell is perfect for tighter curls[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>The Dyson Airwrap styler barrels are designed with flow-vane geometry, to attract, wrap and curl hair using the Coanda effect. Longer and thinner than their sister 30mm barrels, the new 20mm Barrels are engineered to deliver tighter curl styles and enhance curl retention for those with finer hair.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The motor within the tool spins to create an area of high pressure at the top of the styling barrel. A high velocity jet of air disperses out of six air slots around the barrel. This generates a physical phenomenon known as the Coanda effect which allows the hair to curl around the barrel to style.</p>\n\n\n\n<h2>Small Round Volumising Brush Attachment</h2>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496903\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 922px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604060290.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=912\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496903\" width=\"912\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Dyson</figcredit></figure>Got a bob? The Small Round Volumising Brush is for you[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>The smoothing brushes use the Coanda effect to attract hair to the surface of the brush, propelling air along the hair strands to mimic a stylist’s blow-dry technique.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Affectionately named ‘the brush for your bangs’, the new Small Round Volumising Brush is ideal for very short hair and fringes. The 20mm Round volumising brush directs air into the hair to give it body, and the bristles create tension to shape hair as it dries, engineered to create a smooth style with volume.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col sun-col-6\">\n\n\t\t\t<div class=\"rail rail--classic  rail--trending theme-fabulous\" data-slide-count=\"4\" data-slide-count-tablet=\"4\">\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-container\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"rail__header\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3 class=\"rail__title theme__after-color\">MORE BEAUTY DEALS</h3>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-pagination theme__swiper-pagination\"></div>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-wrapper\">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\n<div class=\"rail__item swiper-slide\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"rail__item-image\">\n\t\t\t<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/fabulous/12495164/dyson-announces-two-new-styling-attachments-to-use-with-their-legendary-airwrap-heres-what-they-do/\">\n\t\t\t\t<div data-src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/671-Airwrap-20mm-Barrel-Attachment-In-Use_June-2020_Image.jpg?strip=all&#038;w=300&#038;h=192&#038;crop=1\"></div>\n\t\t\t\t<div from the critically-acclaimed fantasy drama at home with her. </p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496657\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 330px\"><img wooden throne.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>During the tense finale of <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/12241087/sophie-turner-sansa-stark-joe-jonas-baby-girl/\">Game of Thrones</a>, Sansa was crowned Queen of the North after her return to Winterfell and took her rightful place on the throne.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The 24-year-old shared a photo to her Instagram Stories of the epic piece of furniture in its new home, writing &#8220;Welcome Home&#8221; across it.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Sophie and husband Joe Jonas recently welcomed their first baby together, with a spokesperson for the couple confirming the joyful news.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496668\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 778px\"><img of the show Sansa became Queen of the North – legend[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>In a statement given to The Sun, reps for Sophie confirmed the news: &#8220;Sophie Turner and Joe Jonas are delighted to announce the birth of their baby.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Reports that Sophie was pregnant with her husband&#8217;s baby began back in February 2020.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The pair never officially confirmed they were expecting their first child but in May 2020, the couple were spotted out and about in LA with the actress proudly showing off her baby bump.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“The couple is keeping things very hush hush but their friends and family are super excited for them,&#8221; sources told Just Jared earlier in the year, while another source told E!: &#8220;They told their families recently and everyone is ecstatic and so happy for them.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496686\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 926px\"><img masks and gloves every day.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Sophie and Joe officially were married in Las Vegas in an eloped ceremony after the Billboard Awards in May of 2019 where the Jonas Brothers were performing.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Shortly after the show ended Sophie and Joe &#8211; along with a small group of friends and family &#8211; made their way to the Chapel L’Amour inside A Little White Wedding Chapel.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>After their Vegas rendezvous, the newlyweds had a formal wedding in late June of 2019.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496689\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: Man Utd captain, 27, in <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/where/mykonos/\">Mykonos </a>on Thursday.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><strong><img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/26a0.png\" the photo with a red love heart.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Just hours later, <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/who/harry-maguire/\">Maguire </a>was involved in a scuffle with cops on the Greek island after Daisy was allegedly injected with a &#8220;rape drug&#8221;.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The England defender had rushed over to help his sister when he saw her &#8220;eyes had rolled back into her head&#8221; and she was &#8220;fitting&#8221;.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12486846\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img on.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>One cop then allegedly kicked Maguire on the leg and told him: &#8220;Your career is over&#8221;.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>As the girls were “in hysterics crying their eyes out”, the England Christodoulou","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/26a0.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn68@2020_1/2020/08/25/16-46-57-028_8c2ee998bba5b6ed.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603972332.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn4@2020_6/2020/08/25/16-47-13-851_b0db748f52f4c540.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603822108.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn67@2020_1/2020/08/25/16-47-13-466_489de23c4517fa75.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603824910.jpg?strip=all&w=407":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn83@2020_2/2020/08/25/16-47-02-142_a472ae712e4dcc7c.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603268522.jpg?strip=all&w=541":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn32@2020_1/2020/08/25/16-47-06-727_e432f52f53ad556f.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603268519.jpg?strip=all&w=541":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn43@2020_4/2020/08/25/16-47-13-066_4422b0e062cf1c5d.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000578229277.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn55@2020_3/2020/08/25/16-47-04-710_7e2758cf12b44ada.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598374016686},{"createdTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"Majorca and Ibiza hit with record coronavirus cases after 908 infections in 24 hours as mayor warns of ‘second wave","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12492313/majorca-ibiza-coronavirus-record-new-cases/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p><strong>MAJORCA and Ibiza have smashed their previous record for new daily coronavirus cases as 908 new infections were accounted in the last 24 hours.</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>The number is quadruple any of the increases reported in 24 hours to date bringing the total of active <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/topic/coronavirus/\">Covid-19</a> cases to 2,227.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><strong><img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/26a0.png\" alt=\"⚠\" class=\"wp-smiley\" style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 1em;\" /> Read our <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12383728/coronavirus-uk-news-deaths-live-latest-schools/\">coronavirus live blog</a> for the latest news &#38; updates</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12494050\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000596112734.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12494050\" width=\"960\" height=\"697\"/><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>AFP or licensors</figcredit></figure>New lockdown measures have been introduced to Ibiza and Majorca[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12494035\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000601913294.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12494035\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\"/><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Alamy</figcredit></figure>Over the last three days there has been 252 hospital admission in Majorca[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>According to the latest health data there had been 27 new hospitalisations in the last 24 hours and four admissions to ICU.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Spain’s Health ministry has been insisting in recent days that although the cases are rising, the current cases detected are milder and many asymptomatic.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>This has been reflected in the rate of discharges yesterday &#8211; 247 in the last 24 hours.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>This comes as the Government officials warned that the islands are experiencing a second wave.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The number of cases soared over the weekend with 252 hospital admissions in just three days.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>A spokesman for the Autonomous Committee for the Management of Infectious Diseases in the Balearic Islands, Javier Arranz, admitted yesterday that the regions were in the grip of a second wave but said it would not be as strong as the initial wave in March.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>At a press conference, Mr Arranz said: &#8220;We are in a second wave, with a significant rise, which will last a few days.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<script type=\"application/javascript\" src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/pollingwidgets/v3/widget.js?question_id=2850&#038;game=polling\"></script>\n\n\n\n<p>Mr Arranz added that the islands were experiencing community outbreaks, not cases that have come from abroad.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“It is not an infection that comes from outside but is fully located here.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Of the 252 people admitted to hospital, 222 are based in Majorca, more than double the number of new cases at the peak of the virus.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>On March 28, 107 coronavirus cases were confirmed in Balearic Islands.</p>\n\n\n\n<img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/KH-COMP-GRAPH-SPAIN-COVID-19-CASES-21JULY-V2.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-large wp-image-12184026\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" />\n\n\n\n<p>Depending on how the pandemic evolves Mr Arranz said that the Balearic Government would make new decisions on furthering restrictions.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>However, he stressed that the health system was not in a critical situation and that the new cases were milder than that experienced before.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>So far the islands have recorded a total of 5,219 with a sharp rise in cases over the last several weeks.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Health chiefs say new regulations have been in force since August 14 including the <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/travel/12425144/majorca-ibiza-pool-party-ban-coronavirus/\">closure of all nightclubs and pool parties</a> and earlier closing times for pubs.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/politics/12461240/islands-canary-ibiza-mallorca-quarantine-list-regional/\">On August 21 the Transport Secretary</a> suggested that islands like the Canaries, Ibiza or Mallorca could be added to safe travel lists in the future.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Just weeks after the islands were added to the quarantine lists due to a large spike in cases in Spain, the Transport Secretary said in future he wanted to be able to look at data for regions, if possible.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>At the time, the inclusion of the islands sparked uproar among tourists as the rates of infection were far below that of mainland Spain.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col a Spanish island in the coming months as he said the Government were looking at how to make regional quarantines work.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He told the BBC: &#8220;The islands, particularly the Spanish islands, when Spain went into lockdown, we saw in one the numbers coming up and in the other set the numbers coming down &#8211; so we do need to be absolutely sure that you&#8217;re capturing the disease as it actually is and sometimes it&#8217;s not quite as straightforward as it sounds.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He added: &#8220;However, I think there is a case for regionalisation. I think it&#8217;s harder to do within a country – people say, with France for example, why don&#8217;t you just do this region and not the other?</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;The answer is it&#8217;s quite 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"Greece tourist warns of huge crowds and no face masks despite new rules enforced on islands – and says Italy is safer","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/travel/12496097/greece-santorini-crowds-coronavirus-face-masks/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p><strong>A TOURIST in Greece has warned of large crowds and people ignoring face masks at some of the popular hotspots.</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>Travel influencer <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/katie.one/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Katie Giorgadze</a>, currently on holiday on the island of Santorini with her partner, was met by large groups of people when trying to take a picture at sunset.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496513\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 710px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/2673ace4-7fe6-4282-834b-00b7678ab910.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=700\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496513\" width=\"700\" height=\"531\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">The couple found huge crowds and few face masks while trying to catch the sunset in Greece</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>Along with hordes of other travellers, the couple headed to Oia Castle, the popular location to watch the sun go down &#8211; and were met by crowds failing to social distance and barely any face masks.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The 27-year-old told <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/instagram-video-shows-maskless-tourist-crowds-santorini-2020-8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Insider</a> that while she knew it would be busy, locals had said that the island was working at just 50 per cent capacity, meaning it would be much quieter than usual.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>On arrival, however, were people already lining up to take pictures.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She explained: &#8220;I was very shocked by the number of people at the location.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;If it wasn&#8217;t busy for locals, I can hardly imagine how busy it was in previous years.&#8221; </p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496508\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 650px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/b32e15e5-fdf6-4a03-bfca-17561b5e5327.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=640\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496508\" width=\"640\" height=\"430\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">The crowds were all waiting for the sunset on Santorini</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496511\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 650px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/ddc9bccc-0936-4cc3-b538-e74b52f30505.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=640\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496511\" width=\"640\" height=\"767\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Very few people wore face masks &#8211; as the rules don&#8217;t enforce them in public on the island</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496482\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 650px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604054508.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=640\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496482\" width=\"640\" height=\"800\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Face masks only have to be worn indoors on Santorini, but police will move on large crowds</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>She continued: &#8220;Not a lot of travellers were wearing masks.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;That&#8217;s why we decided to stay a little bit separately and to wait for the sun to disappear behind the horizon.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>After the sun had gone down, the crowds quickly dispersed, leaving the small pathway much emptier.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Santorini has new coronavirus restrictions in place after the infection rate across Greece has increased &#8211; with 8,987 total cases &#8211; which includes curfews for bars and clubs between midnight and 7am.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>According to <a href=\"https://greekcitytimes.com/2020/08/25/free-masks-to-tourists-in-santorini/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">local media,</a> authorities on the island have been handing out free face masks to tourists to keep new infections low, with police moving on any large crowds.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>However, Ms Giorgadze added she felt safe for the rest of her trip, with staff wearing masks at the hotel &#8211; although added that she felt even safer in Italy, where they had previously visited as part of their road trip.</p>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"oembed-container oembed-instagram\"><blockquote class=\"instagram-media\" data-instgrm-captioned height: 12.5px; transform: rotate(-45deg) translateX(3px) translateY(1px); width: 12.5px; flex-grow: 0; margin-right: 14px; margin-left: 2px;\"></div> <div style=\"background-color: #F4F4F4; border-radius: 50%; height: 12.5px; width: 12.5px; transform: translateX(9px) translateY(-18px);\"></div></div><div style=\"margin-left: 8px;\"> <div style=\" background-color: #F4F4F4; border-radius: 50%; flex-grow: 0; height: 20px; width: 20px;\"></div> <div style=\" width: 0; height: 0; border-top: 2px solid transparent; border-left: 6px solid #f4f4f4; border-bottom: 2px solid transparent; transform: translateX(16px) translateY(-4px) rotate(30deg)\"></div></div><div style=\"margin-left: auto;\"> <div style=\" width: 0px; border-top: 8px solid #F4F4F4; border-right: 8px solid transparent; transform: translateY(16px);\"></div> <div style=\" background-color: #F4F4F4; flex-grow: 0; height: 12px; width: 16px; transform: translateY(-4px);\"></div> <div style=\" width: 0; height: 0; border-top: 8px solid #F4F4F4; border-left: 8px solid transparent; transform: translateY(-4px) translateX(8px);\"></div></div></div></a> <p style=\" margin:8px 0 0 0; padding:0 4px;\"> <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CCqiHZwIih-/?utm_source=ig_embed&#38;utm_campaign=loading\" style=\" color:#000; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; font-style:normal; font-weight:normal; style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 1em;\" /> Literally every place we visit takes my breath away <img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/1f494.png\" alt=\"💔\" class=\"wp-smiley\" padding:8px 0 7px; text-align:center; text-overflow:ellipsis; white-space:nowrap;\">A post shared by <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/katie.one/?utm_source=ig_embed&#38;utm_campaign=loading\" style=\" color:#c9c8cd; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; font-style:normal; font-weight:normal; line-height:17px;\" target=\"_blank\"> KATIE GIORGADZE</a> (@katie.one) on <time style=\" font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px;\" datetime=\"2020-07-15T13:34:28+00:00\">Jul 15, 2020 at 6:34am PDT</time></p></div></blockquote><script async src=\"//www.instagram.com/embed.js\"></script></div>\n\n\n\n<p>She explained: &#8220;All the places we visited felt extremely empty no matter whether we were in small villages or big cities. We really felt like we were the only tourists.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Comparing the restrictions in Greece and Italy, she warned they were &#8220;much more relaxed&#8221; in the former, as face masks are not enforced on tourists in public spaces.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>However, both Italy and Greece are on the UK&#8217;s safe list as, while both are seeing a rise in daily infections, remain low enough to stay off the UK quarantine list for now.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The UK government, using data from the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) put any country on the watch list if their new daily cases go above 20 per 100,000 population over seven days.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Italy is currently at 10 &#8211; less than the UK &#8211; while Greece is at 14.9.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>Travel restrictions can change at short notice, however, so Brits are advised not to book trips far in advance, and be wary that quarantine measures can be enforced with little warning.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/travel/12444788/greece-turkey-quarantine-list-coronavirus/\">Greece and Turkey</a> have remained off the quarantine list, with Switzerland expected to be next to be removed from the safe list.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Spain, France, Malta and Croatia have all been removed in recent weeks due to coronavirus spikes.</p>\n\n\n\n\t\t<!-- Start of Brightcove Player -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div style=\"display: block; position: relative; min-width: 0px; max-width: 640px;\">\n\t\t\t\t<div style=\"padding-top: 56%; how the information was all a misunderstanding. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>The loved-up duo, who have a baby boy together, still have plans to wed but want to ensure it goes ahead when the pandemic is over. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>They add WWE superstar Bella does not want a socially-distanced wedding and will bide their time before planning a potential date.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Bella has been with Strictly Come Dancing star Chigvintsev since 2018 after they were partnered together on Dancing with the Stars in 2017.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>It came months after she broke up with <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/wwe/10678390/wwe-john-cena-nikka-bella-engagement/\">fellow WWE star John Cena and weeks before they were due to walk down the aisle. </a></p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/wwe/10667657/wwe-nikki-bella-engagement-artem-chigvintsev/\">Only in January did Nikki reveal she was engaged</a> &#8211; two months after Chigvintsev proposed during a trip to France. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Bella revealed: &#8220;Excited for 2020 and the next decade with you @theartemc.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;I said yes in France in November!</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;We have been trying to keep it a secret but really wanted to share our excitement for the New Year!&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496433\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: href=\"http://www.tmz.com/2020/08/22/nikki-bella-lists-dream-arizona-home-brie/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">TMZ</a>&#160;claims the 36-year-old designed the £1.5million property herself but has now decided to flog it.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The home has over five bedrooms and bathrooms and has regularly been shown off by the pair on social media.</p>\n\n\n\n\t\t<!-- Start of +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604053490.jpg?strip=all&w=960","linkMd5":"8f18306dcda4a955f1ab3e480b6410a0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn75@2020_2/2020/08/25/16-46-59-122_8ccd277006b8e956.webp","destWidth":960,"destHeight":960,"sourceBytes":489512,"destBytes":489512,"author":"Richard Forrester","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604053490.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn75@2020_2/2020/08/25/16-46-59-122_8ccd277006b8e956.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604053498.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn3@2020_2/2020/08/25/16-47-07-773_f4eefb04b1a34cdb.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604054206.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn32@2020_6/2020/08/25/16-47-03-571_c73fc7f7d3a84bcb.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604054195.jpg?strip=all&w=769":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn88@2020_6/2020/08/25/16-47-13-972_883164ea9396df42.webp","https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/1f499.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn55@2020_4/2020/08/25/16-47-13-584_c6066252d823488d.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604054199.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn32@2020_3/2020/08/25/16-47-12-075_2cf711b5773cae69.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604054196.jpg?strip=all&w=786":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_6/2020/08/25/16-47-02-729_919bda19d2dc5732.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598374016662},{"createdTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"Inside the Indonesian tribe that dig up their loved ones’ corpses & light up cigarettes for them in annual tradition","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12492608/indonesian-tribe-loved-ones-corpses-cigarettes-tradition/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p><strong>STRANGE photographs show Indonesian families digging up their dead loved ones, dressing them up and lighting cigarettes for them before posing for family snaps.</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>Shots of the Toraja Tribe, who live in South Sulawesi in Indonesia, capture villagers sprucing up their relatives in a bid to obtain good fortune.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495676\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604032853.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495676\" width=\"960\" height=\"639\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Rex Features</figcredit></figure>The Toraja Tribe in Indonesia dig up their dead loved ones, dress them up and light cigarettes for them[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495702\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604033135.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495702\" width=\"960\" height=\"639\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Rex Features</figcredit></figure>A family member poses for a selfie with a corpse[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495726\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604033366.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495726\" width=\"960\" height=\"639\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Rex Features</figcredit></figure>A family poses for a photograph with a deceased relative as part of the ritual[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Images show a family lighting a cigarette hanging inside a corpse’s mouth, dressing skulls in bandanas and taking selfies with the dead bodies.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>There are around one million Torajan people in Indonesia, most of whom live in the South Sulawesi region. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>They believe that after death the soul remains in the house so the dead are treated to&#160;food, clothing, water, cigarettes.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Bodies are kept wrapped in blankets in the room of the house or a ‘tongkonan’ &#8211; a traditional Torajan &#8216;ancestral&#8217; house with a distinctive boat-shaped roof so the rain water runs off.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496207\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604033114-1.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496207\" width=\"960\" height=\"639\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Rex Features</figcredit></figure>A corpse wears a bandana after being exhumed and cleaned in the ritual[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495791\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604033299.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495791\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Rex Features</figcredit></figure>The tribe often keeps the bodies of their deceased loved ones in the family home for weeks[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495807\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000470466379.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495807\" width=\"960\" height=\"641\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Claudio Sieber</figcredit></figure>A member of the tribe lights a cigarette of a deceased relative[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>The fascinating snaps were captured by freelance photojournalist Hariandi Hafid show the Toraja tribe taking part in the “Manene” ritual &#8211; in which family members exhume and clean the bodies of the dead.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Unlike in western cultures, where the body is swiftly removed after death and frequently held a few days later, the tribe often keeps the bodies of their deceased loved ones in the family home for weeks, if not months.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>During this time, the corpse will be spoken to in general conversation and a meal brought to the body three or four times a day.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Once a funeral is held – after a suitable period of mourning and reflection – it is often a lavish affair costing exorbitant amounts of money and held over several days.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496106\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604033367.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496106\" width=\"960\" height=\"639\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Rex Features</figcredit></figure>A family poses with the dead as part of the &#8220;Mannena&#8221; ritual[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496114\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604033110.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496114\" width=\"960\" height=\"639\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Rex Features</figcredit></figure>The Indonesian villagers dig up their dead love ones every three to four years as part of a bizarre ceremony[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496116\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604032843.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496116\" width=\"960\" height=\"639\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Rex Features</figcredit></figure>The corpses are placed standing up for a family photoshoot[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>The Toraja believe that death is just the next step in the soul’s journey through the universe.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“My mother died suddenly, so we aren’t ready yet to let her go,” a Torajan woman, Yohana Palangda, told&#160;<a href=\"https://www.nationalgeographic.com/magazine/2016/04/death-dying-grief-funeral-ceremony-corpse/\">National Geographic</a>&#160;in 2016 of how this helps the grieving process.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“I can’t accept burying her too quickly.”</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496125\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604032822.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496125\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Rex Features</figcredit></figure>A family member poses with a dead relative[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496127\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604033112-1.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496127\" width=\"960\" height=\"639\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Rex Features</figcredit></figure>The Toraja believe that death is just the next step in the soul’s journey through the universe[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496132\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604033126.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496132\" width=\"960\" height=\"639\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Rex Features</figcredit></figure>The tribe believes the ritual brings them good fortune[/caption]\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col Dons TONIGHT.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/team/1196653/arsenal/\">Mikel Arteta&#8217;s Gunners</a> will be preparing for their Community Shield match with Liverpool on Saturday. Dons vs Arsenal takes place tonight, Tuesday August, 25.</li>\n<li>The match will kick off at <strong>6pm BST.</strong></li>\n<li>The Stadium:MK plays host, with no fans in attendance.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2>What TV channel and live stream is MK Dons vs Arsenal on?</h2>\n<ul>\n<li>MK Dons vs Arsenal will be available to watch for FREE.</li>\n<li>MK Dons will be showing it on <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCuo5VY346080kg6D3Fz3-Q\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\">their YouTube channel.</a> Though the Dons add that their stream will only be available for those based in the UK.</li>\n<li>Arsenal will be showing the game on <a href=\"https://www.arsenal.com/membership/digital\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"Watch David Stockdale’s horror blunder vs West Ham as ball trickles through Wycombe keeper’s legs into goal","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12495955/stockdale-west-ham-wycombe-goalkeeper-error/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>DAZED David Stockdale <strong>might still be Wandering what happened after the keeper&#8217;s spectacular mishap in Wycombe&#8217;s 5-1 friendly defeat against West Ham.</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>The former <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/team/3571589/brighton-hove-albion/\">Brighton</a> star was mocked on social media after the softest of backpasses from Darius Charles rolled between the stopper&#8217;s legs for on own goal.</p>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"oembed-container oembed-twitter\"><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-width=\"550\" data-dnt=\"true\"><p lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\">Here is the own goal from Wycombe earlier. Shouldn&#39;t laugh, but still. <a href=\"https://t.co/H0sZIhb2gx\">pic.twitter.com/H0sZIhb2gx</a></p>&#8212; Sam Inkersole (@Sam_InkersoleTM) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/Sam_InkersoleTM/status/1298253800688381954?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">August 25, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script></div>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496275\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604051546.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496275\" width=\"960\" height=\"543\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>West Ham United FC</figcredit></figure>David Stockdale can&#8217;t believe what has happened as the ball rolls into the right corner, joining a spare ball in the opposite corner[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496270\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604051550.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496270\" width=\"960\" height=\"543\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>West Ham United FC</figcredit></figure>Surely not! Veteran keeper David Stockdale reacts to his lapse, but it&#8217;s too late to stop Darius Charles&#8217; backpass going in[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Stockdale, 34, is experienced enough not to let his comic blunder undermine his self-belief, having battled up from the lower levels of non-League football to the Premier League with <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/team/1225801/fulham/\">Fulham</a> in a much-travelled career.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But as the loanee from <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/team/1225614/birmingham-city/\">Birmingham</a> held his head in his hands &#8211; as players from both sides looked on transfixed in disbelief &#8211; he will be grateful his blunder happened in early pre-season.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Even the match commentator was almost caught out, admitting he had switched off when the ball was rolled back to Stockdale from about 30 yards out.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He suddenly let out: &#8220;It&#8217;s an own goal! Well, I have to say I looked down there, for a second..&#8221;   </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Some uncharitable <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/team/1196655/west-ham/\">Hammers</a>&#8216; fans compared Stockdale&#8217;s blooper for <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/6165594/wycombe-wanderers-promoted/\">Championship new boys Wanderers</a> to the woes of London Stadium&#8217;s  same-aged flop Roberto.</p>\n\n\n\n<img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/wycombe.png?strip=all&#38;w=601\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496056\" width=\"601\" height=\"797\" />\n\n\n\n<img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/WYCOMBE3.png?strip=all&#38;w=597\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496109\" width=\"597\" height=\"495\" />\n\n\n\n<p>The -ex-Espanyol No1 infamously let in 21 goals in 10 games under previous <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/team/1196655/west-ham/\">West Ham</a> boss Maneul Pellegrini before current manager David Moyes sent him on loan to Alaves.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Many Hammers&#8217; supporters were surprised to hear the LaLiga club are now reportedly keen on signing the £30,000-a-week keeper permanently.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And after seeing Stockdale&#8217;s mistake on Twitter, posts included: &#8220;Roberto’s twin is in goal for Wycombe&#8221; &#8230;&#8221;They have Roberto in goal?&#8221; &#8230; and &#8220;That&#8217;s worthy of Roberto&#8221;.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.football.london/\">Football.london</a>&#8216;s West Ham correspondent Sam Inkersole posted the calamity clip with the caption: &#8220;Here is the own goal from Wycombe earlier. Shouldn&#8217;t laugh, but still. &#8220;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496283\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604051521.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496283\" width=\"960\" height=\"543\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>West Ham United FC</figcredit></figure>There seems no danger as Wycombe&#8217;s experienced centre-back Darius Charles rolls the ball back to his stopper David Stockdale[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496279\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604051524.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496279\" width=\"960\" height=\"543\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>West Ham United FC</figcredit></figure>Ex-AFC Wimbledon and Burton defender Darius Charles measures a routine backpass &#8211; with unexpected consequences[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>But responses included: &#8220;I think laughing is fair game for that one.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>As for the game overall, Michail Antonio was everywhere for the Hammers, who were coached by Stuart Pearce and Alan Irvine as Moyes was watching a simultaneous 4-1 win at Ipswich.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Arthur Masuaku chipped a brilliant early opener and Charles&#8217; own goal made it 2-0 before Alex Samuel replied instantly.</p>\n\n\n\n<img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/WYCOMBE2.png?strip=all&#38;w=594\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496096\" width=\"594\" height=\"464\" />\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container star.</strong></p>\n<p>Hard-as-nails veteran Safe Voyage will clock up some serious air miles in the coming weeks after a dominant success at York on Saturday.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12493419\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img class=\"size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12493419\" Voyage&#8217;s win at York was a career-best</figcaption><figcredit>PA:Press Association</figcredit></figure></p>\n<p>The gelding galloped a top field, including dual Group 1 winner <strong>One Master</strong>, into the ground in the City Of York Stakes.</p>\n<p>It was a career-best performance from the seven-year-old and he is now rated higher than at any point in his career off 116.</p>\n<p>He was fourth in the Group 1 Prix de la Foret last season and he will be heading back to Longchamp in the form of his life.</p>\n<p>And provided his trip to Paris goes according to plan, he will hop on a jet across the pond to the Breeders&#8217; Cup.</p>\n<p>\t<div class=\"article-boxout\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\">\n\t\t\t<h3 a seven-year-old.</p>\n<p>&#8220;All being well we are thinking about going to the Foret and the Breeders&#8217; Cup Mile with him now.</p>\n<p>&#8220;He proved that he gets a mile in the QEII at Ascot last year on atrocious ground, so he will have no trouble getting the mile around Keeneland.</p>\n<p></p>\n<p>&#8220;The timing is perfect for him between now and the Foret and then the Breeders&#8217; Cup.</p>\n<p>&#8220;He is entered in the Boomerang Mile on Irish Champions weekend but the he wouldn&#8217;t be able to run in the Foret if he ran there, so that would be unlikely.&#8221;</p>\n<p>Quinn continued: &#8220;He has been a great horse for the public, he is great to watch. He always turns up on the big day.</p>\n<p>&#8220;He was brilliant at Epsom on Derby day on ground wasn&#8217;t absolutely ideal for him and he was brilliant at York. He is a pleasure to deal with.&#8221;</p>\n<p>Crack sprinter <strong>Liberty Beach</strong> is also set to head overseas, with the Group 1 Flying Five at the Curragh in her sights.</p>\n<p>She was fourth behind <strong>Battaash</strong> in the King George at Glorious Goodwood but she won&#8217;t have that Abbaye-bound rival to contend with next month.</p>\n<p>Quinn said: &#8220;She&#8217;s in flying form, she&#8217;s going very nicely at the moment. 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"Brilliant new SIM deal gets you 100GB of data for JUST £15 a month","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/12493807/sim-deal-100gb-data-15-smarty/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>SIM-ONLY deals have gotten better and better in 2020, and Smarty’s latest offer is its best yet.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The mobile provider has announced a big change to its £15 a month SIM plan, doubling the data to 100GB a month for a whole year.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12494002\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/V01_SMARTY_Indirect-Promo_Sept-100GB_1920x10804.png?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12494002\" width=\"960\" height=\"540\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Smarty&#8217;s new double data offer gets you a whopping 100GB</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>Until recently £15 a month generally got mobile users 50GB monthly data, good value &#8211; but things have shifted.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>ID Mobile recently doubled its £15 a month plan to offer a big 100GB of data.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Now Smarty’s doubled its own £15 a month plan which means another opportunity for mobile users to get more 4G data for less and boost streaming opportunities.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Smarty&#8217;s new offer is available as of 2pm Tuesday, August 25 and runs up until October 6.</p>\n\n\n\n<ul><li><strong>Smarty £15 a month rolling SIM, 100GB data for 12 months (double data) &#8211; <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=10933&#38;awinaffid=255437&#38;clickref=12493807+-+Smarty+100GB+deal&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fsmarty.co.uk%2Fplans%2F50gb-data\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\">buy here</a></strong></li></ul>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12494054\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000531731362-2.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12494054\" width=\"960\" height=\"721\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Smarty SIMs operate on the Three network</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>Rolling SIM-only deals offer great value if you’re at the end of a pay monthly contract and want to keep using the same phone.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>They are also good if you prefer to buy phones outright, and don’t want to be tied into a monthly contract.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Smarty usually leads the pack on big-data SIM plans, while ID Mobile supports smartphone users wanting low-cost, good value options.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Both providers offer rolling 30-day plans, which means you aren’t locked in and can change you plan at any time.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>While incredible value, Smarty’s new offer boosts the regular 50GB allowance to 100GB for a year, after which it returns to 50GB.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/12393621/double-data-sim-deal-100gb-id-mobile-three/\">ID Mobile’s plan doesn’t appear to offer a set time on the double data</a>; it also offers data-rollover and bill capping options.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Smarty’s new 100GB offer is still excellent value though, with doube data not to be sniffed at and the company promising no speed restrictions. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Smarty service operates on the Three network: if you haven’t used the network before do check coverage if you are swapping from another network provider.</p>\n\n\n\n<ul><li><strong>Smarty £15 a month rolling SIM, 100GB data for 12 months (double data) &#8211; <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=10933&#38;awinaffid=255437&#38;clickref=12493807+-+Smarty+100GB+deal&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fsmarty.co.uk%2Fplans%2F50gb-data\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">buy here</a></strong></li></ul>\n\n\n\n<p><em>All prices in this article were correct at the time of writing, but may have since changed. Always do your own research before making any purchase.</em></p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row class=\"swiper-container\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"rail__header\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3 class=\"rail__title theme__after-color\">Most read in Phones &#38; Gadgets</h3>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-pagination theme__swiper-pagination\"></div>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-wrapper\">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\n<div class=\"rail__item swiper-slide\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"rail__item-image\">\n\t\t\t<a -->\n\t</div><!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index-->\n\t</div> <!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>Elsewhere <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/12486352/iphone-12-september-launch-date-apple/\">iPhone 12’s September launch date has been revealed by Apple</a> in a major slip-up.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Alexa is now under £30 as<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/12486910/amazon-alexa-echo-dot-deal-discount-cheap-buy-price/\"> Amazon slashes price of Echo Dot smart speaker by nearly HALF</a></p>\n\n\n\n<p>If you&#8217;re looking for tech producrts and recommendations, head over to <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/topic/sun-selects-tech/\">Sun Selects Tech. </a></p>\n\n\n\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n\n\n\n<p><em>If you click on a link in this article and buy a product we will earn revenue.</em> </p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 15:34:00 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/V01_SMARTY_Indirect-Promo_Sept-100GB_1920x10804.png?strip=all&w=960","linkMd5":"6fa52dcc65e0b66fd43efb35b2c5b1e1","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn84@2020_4/2020/08/25/16-46-56-994_a2edd10bfac97216.webp","destWidth":960,"destHeight":540,"sourceBytes":24644,"destBytes":24644,"author":"Kevin Pocock","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/V01_SMARTY_Indirect-Promo_Sept-100GB_1920x10804.png?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn84@2020_4/2020/08/25/16-46-56-994_a2edd10bfac97216.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000531731362-2.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn47@2020_6/2020/08/25/16-47-01-169_2a5c49c40cd2ffa9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598374016693},{"createdTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"Neymar crumbled when PSG needed him against Bayern Munich, and when it mattered most his game went to pieces","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12496129/neymar-psg-tim-vickery/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p><strong>AFTER Paris Saint Germain had lost to Bayern Munich in Sunday’s Champions League final, Neymar went to social media to make the point that the team had given its all and that losing was a part of sport.</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>It was a classic example of one of the defining features of social media – that what you represent is not necessarily what you are.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496532\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 649px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603666860.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=639\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496532\" width=\"639\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>EPA</figcredit></figure>Neymar was reduced to tears after PSG&#8217;s loss to Bayern Munich in the Champions League final[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Because the Neymar we had all seen on the Lisbon pitch did not appear to behave at all as if he thought that losing was a part of sport.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12481989/neymar-runners-up-medal-ferdinand-psg-respect/\">He greeted defeat with a river of tears</a>, and had to be coaxed out of his seat to join his team-mates and collect his medal.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>True, those in sport can never be happy to lose. But the real problem here was not how Neymar behaved after the final whistle had blown – it was the way that the prospect of defeat had a negative effect on his performance during the game.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>There have been many times when <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/9804227/neymar-transfer-career/\">Neymar has been criticised unjustly.</a></p>\n\n\n\n<p>His petulant excesses mean that many are reluctant to praise him, and quick to blame him for things that are not his fault.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>It is unfair to pin Brazil’s disastrous 2014 World Cup on his slender shoulders – he was injured in the quarter finals.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And his displays in Russia two years ago were pretty good bearing in mind that he was making his way back from an extended injury absence.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And before this season he had been forced out of almost all the knock out games that PSG had played in the Champions League over the past two years.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>There is also clearly much more to him than the appearance – that he can often give on the field – <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/8408697/neymar-tim-vickery/\">of being a spoiled eternal adolescent</a>. He is usually popular with his team-mates.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But too much of that adolescent remains – and that, for his many fans, is the most disappointing lesson of the 2020 Champions League final.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496521\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603670679.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496521\" width=\"960\" height=\"644\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Manu Fernandez</figcredit></figure>When PSG needed him most Neymar crumbled under the pressure[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496524\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603670935-1.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496524\" width=\"960\" height=\"689\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>Neymar failed to lift his PSG team-mates when they went 1-0 down[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>It is undeniable that he is under enormous pressure. Brazil have many excellent players.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But Neymar is the stand out talent, the man expected to live up to the legacy of Pele and Garrincha.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And when he left Barcelona, moving out of the shadow of Lionel Messi, he was making a conscious choice to accept the pressures of carrying PSG to greatness.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>On Sunday it all looked too much. Not because he played badly. He did some fine things in the first half. His acceleration and balance were both on show with the left footed shot that was well blocked by Manuel Neuer.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The problem was that once Bayern took the lead – at the moment that PSG most needed their star man to step up – he crumbled.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The real test of a team, and of a player, is the response to going behind. Neymar failed this one badly.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>For a 20 minute spell after the goal, he could do nothing right. His every touch was an error.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>All players go through bad spells. They can get themselves back in rhythm by keeping it simple, retaining possession and rediscovering their touch. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Neymar seemed unable to do this. He was so emotionally affected by the proximity of defeat that, when it mattered most, his game went to pieces.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>In competitive matches for Brazil Neymar has only been on the losing side twice – not counting a penalty shoot out defeat back in 2011.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496548\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 786px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603662609.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=776\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496548\" width=\"776\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>EPA</figcredit></figure>Neymar seemed to lose his touch and belief in the second half [/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496589\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/1a5495cd-5b55-4a96-9f00-7b585cabdc54.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496589\" width=\"960\" height=\"626\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>Neymar was left ruing what could&#8217;ve been at the final whistle[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>There was the quarter final loss to Belgium in Russia 2018, which he confessed was a huge blow.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And there was a 1-0 defeat to Colombia in the Copa America of 2015, when he was superbly marked by Carlos Sanchez – and became so frustrated that he lashed out at the referee after the game and picked up a long suspension.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col sun-col-6\">\n\n\t\t\t<div class=\"rail rail--classic  rail--trending theme-sport\" data-slide-count=\"4\" data-slide-count-tablet=\"4\">\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-container\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"rail__header\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3 class=\"rail__title theme__after-color\">Most read in Football</h3>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-pagination theme__swiper-pagination\"></div>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-wrapper\">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\n<div class=\"rail__item swiper-slide\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"rail__item-image\">\n\t\t\t<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12492905/harry-maguire-sister-injected-drug-albanians-mykonos-trial-brawl/\">\n\t\t\t\t<div class=\"delayed-image-load-landscape\" data-src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/DD-COMPOSITE-SPLASH.jpg?strip=all&#038;w=300&#038;h=192&#038;crop=1\"></div>\n\t\t\t\t<div class=\"delayed-image-load-mobile\" data-src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/DD-COMPOSITE-SPLASH.jpg?strip=all&#038;w=300&#038;h=192&#038;crop=1\"></div>\n\t\t\t</a>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<!-- Add video indicator if article has feature video. -->\n\t\t\t\t<div class=\"rail__item-play theme__background-color-rgba-80\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<span></span>\n\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail__item-image -->\n\t\n\t<div fault not just in him but in those who have developed him. And until he can cope better with the prospect of defeat, the great triumphs will be much more difficult to achieve.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Going into Sunday’s big game, many in Brazil were trusting that their big star was now ‘Ney Adult.’</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He may be closer to 29 than 28, but under the harsh spotlight of the global glare, Neymar showed that there is still work to be done on his emotional development for that tag to be true.</p>\n\n\n\n\t\t<!-- Start of Brightcove Player -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div style=\"display: block; position: relative; min-width: 0px; max-width: 640px;\">\n\t\t\t\t<div Boon","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603666860.jpg?strip=all&w=639":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn86@2020_3/2020/08/25/16-46-56-979_753f134665841532.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603670679.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn35@2020_1/2020/08/25/16-47-08-949_0cddbd38e251e620.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603670935-1.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn64@2020_5/2020/08/25/16-47-01-605_41364c8b4040af4b.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603662609.jpg?strip=all&w=776":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn79@2020_3/2020/08/25/16-47-10-905_942dba5cb39b9124.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/1a5495cd-5b55-4a96-9f00-7b585cabdc54.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn37@2020_5/2020/08/25/16-47-01-411_4be04ec6d32790e3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598374016661},{"createdTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"Who was Charlie Mott and how was his death marked on The One Show?","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/12490888/charlie-mott-researcher-death-the-one-show-tribute/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>THE One Show is mourning the death of a member of its team, Charlie Mott.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Presenter Alex Jones <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/12489198/alex-jones-tears-one-show-colleague-sudden-death/\">revealed the sad news on the programme that Mott had passed away</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489234\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 210px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603894148.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=200\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489234\" width=\"200\" height=\"200\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Linkedin</figcredit></figure>Charlie Mott tragically passed away at the weekend[/caption]\n\n\n\n<h2>Who was Charlie Mott?</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>Charlie was a researcher on <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/topic/the-one-show/\">The One Show</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He is thought to be just three years out of University, having graduated from Bournemouth in 2017.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>According to his LinkedIn profile, Charlie had worked at the <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/topic/bbc/\">BBC</a> for just over two years, having joined the broadcaster in 2018 as a studio researcher.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He passed away sometime over the weekend of August 22 to 23 but his cause of death has not yet been confirmed.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489227\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/alex-4.png?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489227\" width=\"960\" height=\"668\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Alex fought back tears as she paid tribute</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<h2>How was Charlie Mott&#8217;s death marked on The One Show?</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>On August 25, 2020, <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/who/alex-jones/\">Alex Jones</a> fought back tears as <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/12489198/charlie-mott-alex-jones-tears-one-show-sudden-death/\">she paid tribute to Charlie</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The 43-year-old presenter dedicated the end of the show to him.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Closing the show, Alex told viewers: &#8220;Now, before we go, we just wanted to pay tribute to one of our colleagues Charlie Mott, who sadly died at the weekend.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;Everybody on the team is absolutely devastated. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;He was hugely talented and such good company. We miss him so much.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Clearly overwhelmed with emotion, the star added: &#8220;Our thoughts are with his family and we are sending lots of love from all of us here.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>As a mark of respect for Charlie, The One Show did not include their upbeat theme music as the credits rolled after the show.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Instead, the closing frames aired in complete silence.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col night","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/travel/12434247/august-bank-holiday-weekend-last-minute-deals/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p><strong>BRITS looking forward to the long bank holiday weekend can still book a last minute UK break for a staycation.</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>Thankfully, there are still some cheap deals for a long weekend away, be it camping or a hotel break.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12434637\" width=\"660\" height=\"465\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Haven</figcredit></figure>A last minute bank holiday staycation can be yours from just £14 each[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Brits have been opting for UK holidays this summer, as holiday hotspots such as France, Spain and Croatia are placed back onto the quarantine list.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>With fears of being stranded abroad or having holidays cancelled at the last minute, a staycation has become more popular than ever.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>This has also led to overbooking problems and limited availability &#8211; many <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/travel/12309869/uk-campsites-farm-summer-holiday-camping/\">campsites are fully booked</a> until the end of August while some families <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/travel/12421628/holidays-cancelled-last-minute-booking-staycation/\">found their room already taken</a> when they arrived.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Here are some of the best deals we have rounded up across the country, with camping, hotels and holiday park bargains from £35.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12435643\" -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>Blackpool has seen the <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/travel/12431196/blackpool-uk-holiday-staycation-beach/\">highest visitor numbers in a decade</a>, as Brits ditch Spain for the seaside resort.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Director of Blackpool Tourism Alan Cavill told Sun Online Travel: &#8220;Our best measure for numbers is our car parks &#8211; they are busier than they have been for ten years.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;We&#8217;ve done better this July than July last year.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n\t\t<!-- Start of Brightcove Player -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div -->\n\n\t\t\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 15:16:00 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000583708499.jpg?strip=all&w=660","linkMd5":"c3ee22ee600c261505a54c9f5307a4ad","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn71@2020_3/2020/08/25/16-46-58-832_a60a74c5d2a85c5c.webp","destWidth":660,"destHeight":465,"sourceBytes":44118,"destBytes":44118,"author":"Kara Godfrey","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000583708499.jpg?strip=all&w=660":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn71@2020_3/2020/08/25/16-46-58-832_a60a74c5d2a85c5c.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000602700056.jpg?strip=all&w=660":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn43@2020_2/2020/08/25/16-47-01-078_e0cad5429c084f53.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598374016684},{"createdTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"Face masks in school will only fuel paranoia amongst our poor kids","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12495448/face-masks-school-kids-scotland-nicola-sturgeon/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/article_banner2.png\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/article_banner2.png?strip=all&#38;w=887\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12361714\" width=\"887\" height=\"160\"/></a>\n\n\n\n<p><strong>WHAT are we doing to our poor kids?</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>Members of Generation Corona are already likely to be gripped by an unnatural level of people paranoia, social anxiety and terror of germs because of a virus that largely leaves their age group untouched.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495942\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000592180393-8.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495942\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>What are we doing to Generation Covid, who are already facing paranoia and social anxiety as a result of the pandemic.[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Now they’re finally getting back to school, but Nicola Sturgeon has decided Scots over 12-years-old need to be muzzled by wearing masks in school corridors and communal areas.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Just imagine how difficult that is going to make communication and learning in what is already a suboptimal “new normal” without many of the opportunities that can make schooling great.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495944\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000571772971-1.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495944\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Alamy</figcredit></figure>Making kids wear face masks inside schools will make communication and learning so difficult.[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>And given its recent track record for U-turns, how long before the English government follows suit?</p>\n\n\n\n<p>National Education Union leader Kevin Courtney is, predictably, already suggesting they should do just that.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He has said that “face masks will help to alleviate anxiety” felt by staff, parents and students about going back to school.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496217\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/3fd2f500-f3a1-4d94-9833-6793e718b764.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496217\" width=\"960\" height=\"631\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>I think it&#8217;s wrong that face masks will help to alleviate anxiety felt by kids. It will do the opposite.[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>I argue it will do the complete opposite for kids and teenagers who don’t have any practical reason to feel this fear.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Especially given, as the Deputy Chief Medical Officer Doctor Jenny Harries has correctly pointed out, there is a higher risk of being involved in a road traffic accident on the way to school than getting Covid.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Since reopening in June, just one in 10,000 schools have had any so-called “outbreaks” of the virus at all.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>According to Public Health England, only 70 out of one million children contracted coronavirus, a disease which we now know poses an incredibly low risk for children.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495951\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000602306392-3.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495951\" width=\"960\" height=\"639\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>© Lucy Young</figcredit></figure>The government could be heading for yet another u-turn over face masks in schools.[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>While an utter tragedy, only one child in the UK has died without already suffering from underlying health conditions.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And here’s the crux: Guidance from the Department for Education says the misuse of masks by children could actually INCREASE the risk of transmission.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>It’s going to be critical that the media maintains a sensible approach when reporting on Covid in schools over the coming weeks.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495953\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 746px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604049302.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=736\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495953\" width=\"736\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>Nicola Sturgeon&#8217;s muzzling of children in Scotland is yet another needless move aimed at boosting her popularity.[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Sure, there will be cases. We are living with this damn thing and there remains no vaccine.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But we must remember the wider context of risk and how much has changed since the peak of the pandemic.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The facts show the average daily death toll from the virus is down to just ten throughout August, a far cry from the 800 dying every 24 hours in April.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Just 306 of the 51,935 deaths recorded by the ONS throughout this crisis have been folk aged under 40.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row
