winger Nicolas Gonzalez</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>Premier League new boys Leeds were recently in talks with Marcelo Bielsa&#8217;s 22-year-old coutryman.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But the German side were never interested in selling, according to Arsenal&#8217;s former head of recruitment Mislintat.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He said: &#8220;I don&#8217;t see [a departure] coming for now.</p>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"wp-block-group\"><div class=\"wp-block-group__inner-container\">\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n\n\n\n<h2><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12371286/transfer-news-live-winks-man-city-cristiano-ronaldo-barcelona-spurs-liverpool/\">TRANSFER NEWS LIVE: Breaking news, juicy gossip and the biggest deals</a></h2>\n\n\n\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n</div></div>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;We had a lot of rumours in the beginning. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;It was very serious with Leeds. But at no point it was really convincing for him or for us.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Gonzalez has three years left on his contract with the Bundesliga side.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Stuttgart signed him from Argentinos Juniors for £7.65million in 2018.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And the German side would want at least double that to prise him away.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Gonzalez came off the bench during Stuttgart&#8217;s 3-0 pre-season friendly defeat to Liverpool on Saturday. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>And it looks like he will be staying put in Germany until at least January.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div -->\n\n\t\t\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 16:16:54 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/crop-12496284.jpg?strip=all&w=960","linkMd5":"262ed8108239cb1dfd6a79332fda6d60","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn35@2020_2/2020/08/25/16-46-58-846_debd4cae684181b7.webp","destWidth":960,"destHeight":639,"sourceBytes":54646,"destBytes":54646,"author":"William Pugh","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/crop-12496284.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn35@2020_2/2020/08/25/16-46-58-846_debd4cae684181b7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598374016660},{"createdTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"Mum-of-three, 29, and dad-of-two, 37, died after crashing into tree in heavy rain during Storm Ellen","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12495870/mum-dad-died-crash-tree-storm-ellen/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>A MUM-of-three and a dad-of-two died after their car crashed into a tree in heavy rain during Storm Ellen. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Tanya Jackson, 29, and Brett Rogers, 37, were travelling in a Vauxhall Insignia that skidded off the A52 in <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/where/derbyshire/\">Derbyshire</a> on Saturday afternoon.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496141\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 730px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604023131.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=720\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496141\" width=\"720\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>©Ashley Kirk</figcredit></figure>Tanya Jackson died after the car she was travelling in crashed into a tree[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496145\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 745px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604024417.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=735\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496145\" width=\"735\" height=\"741\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>©Ashley Kirk</figcredit></figure>She was travelling with Brett Rogers who also died in the fatal crash[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496075\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603506863.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496075\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>©Ashley Kirk</figcredit></figure>Their car rolled on its side after colliding with a tree during Storm Ellen[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>The car was pictured on its side after the crash, leading to the A52, near Derby, being closed for six hours.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Heartfelt tributes were today paid online to the couple, who both died at the scene.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>An old school pal of Tanya’s said he believed the couple had been in a recent relationship together.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He said: “It’s such a tragedy. She had two girls and a boy &#8211; they are only young.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“She was very quiet at school but she was always pretty popular.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“She’s been taken so young. It’s so sad.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>A friend wrote on social media: “I never knew u properly but fly high with your mum such a sad loss xx.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Another added: “Another school friend, another tragic loss, another life taken so young RIP Tanya Jackson fly high girl.”</p>\n\n\n\n<h2>&#8216;TAKEN SO SOON&#8217;</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>Brett, from Derby, was said to have left behind two children, a girl and a boy.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Dozens of friends wrote on his Facebook describing their shock at his death.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>One said: “So sad to hear that you’ve been taken so soon, I will miss you massively.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“Thank you for the things you did for me, rest easy brother, I’ll see you again soon.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Another added: “So shocked to hear such tragic news. My heart goes out to his children and family at such a very sad time.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Emergency services were called to the A52, around 100 yards from the M1 junction, at 4.55pm on Saturday, August 22.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The crash happened as the last of Storm Ellen’s heavy rain fell on the area.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Police have appealed for witnesses and dashcam footage.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"EastEnders’ Maisie Smith tries out Instagram filler filter and says she ‘wants it to stay’ as she shows off new look","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/12495282/eastenders-maisie-smith-instagram-filler-new-look/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>EASTENDERS star Maisie Smith loves to play about with all the Instagram filters to pass a bit of time. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>And it looks like the actress &#8211; who plays Tiffany Butcher in the BBC soap &#8211; definitely liked what she saw when she was messing around on her phone earlier today. </p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495905\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 650px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/34516775-c675-4ab3-a882-5492cfb70f32.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=640\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495905\" width=\"640\" height=\"754\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>instagram</figcredit></figure>Maisie Smith tries out Instagram filler filter and &#8220;wants it to stay&#8221;[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>The TV star, 19, took to her Instagram Story to share the edited version of herself with her 694k followers on her platform. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Maisie approved of what was reflected back in her screen and said: &#8220;This is what I would like all the time.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She then added: &#8220;Whatever this is. This can stay. I approve,&#8221; before putting her oversized shades on and ending the video with a sassy pout. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>When the teen isn&#8217;t messing around with the endless filters on the popular social media platform, she&#8217;s filming hilarious TikTok videos or keeping fit in the gym. </p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495917\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 650px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/df39e996-1fdb-42c0-86de-b37ad2be246a.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=640\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495917\" width=\"640\" height=\"824\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>instagram</figcredit></figure>Maisie definitely liked what the filter did to her naturally pretty face[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495920\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 650px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/25c7e9b5-c86d-4064-9144-cab817e619c4.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=640\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495920\" width=\"640\" height=\"776\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>instagram</figcredit></figure>At the end of the video the star put her huge sunglasses on and gave her best duck pout[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Maisie has become a bit of a TikTok sensation over the past year as she&#8217;s enjoyed entertaining herself and others on the social media platform during lockdown.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>During her most recent post she insisted her mum is a better dancer than her as they teamed up for a new video.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>In the video,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/11328723/eastenders-maisie-smith-dances-lookalike-mum/\">Maisie</a>&#160;and Julia are dance in unison, with the flame-haired star dressed in a baggy top and grey shorts.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The pair danced in the kitchen of their seaside home wearing sunglasses, and Maisie captioned her video: &#8220;My mum actually better than me at this point @js.management inspired by @nathancats.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495935\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 456px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000581254133.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=446\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495935\" width=\"446\" height=\"536\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Instagram</figcredit></figure>Maisie has loved filming funny videos with her family in lockdown[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>But earlier this month The Sun revealed her <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/12406840/eastenders-maisie-smith-bbc-investigation-bad-behaviour/\">future on EastEnders is in jeopardy after BBC chiefs opened an investigation into her unruly behaviour.</a></p>\n\n\n\n<p>In July the actress was<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/12177310/eastenders-maisie-smith-smoking-spliff-in-car/\"> photographed smoking cannabis at the wheel</a>&#160;of a car and now she has allegedly breached terms of her contract by signing a deal to promote brands on TikTok. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Maisie,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/12325567/maisie-smith-eastenders-dance-moves-recreates-little-mix-holiday-music-video/\">who has 1.7 million TikTok followers</a>, was ­offered a huge sum by a leading record label to post their artists’ tracks over clips of her online videos.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Despite being told she couldn&#8217;t take part, the star went ahead and did it for a second time. </p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496231\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 634px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/1f48a424-cf0e-4eb9-bf11-0e8eae1237c3.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=624\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496231\" width=\"624\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Rex Features</figcredit></figure>Maisie has become a huge star on TikTok and has an impressive [/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496343\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"James Anderson takes 600th Test wicket to become first Englishman and only fourth player EVER to reach incredible total","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/cricket/12496919/james-anderson-takes-600th-test-wicket-to-become-first-englishman-and-only-fourth-player-ever-to-reach-incredible-total/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>PETER PAN paceman James Anderson notched an historic 600th Test wicket for England as the world&#8217;s fourth most successful bowler ever returned to his best against Pakistan.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The Lancashire seamer, 38, had tourists&#8217; skipper Azhar Ali caught at slip by skipper Joe Root on the final day of what seems an inevitable Third Test draw at Southampton&#8217;s Ageas Bowl.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12497047\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604061800.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12497047\" width=\"960\" height=\"639\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>AP:Associated Press</figcredit></figure>England fast-bowler James Anderson celebrates reaching the magical 600 mark[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Anerson trails only three leg-spinnes in the all-time list &#8211; 800-wicket Sri Lankan Muttiah Muralitharan, Aussie legend Shane Warne&#8217;s 708 and the 619 of India&#8217;s Anil Kumble.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Lancashire coach Glen chapple told he BBC: “I’m not sure there is any context for an achievement like Jimmy’s. It’s ridiculous, really, 600 Test wickets in 18 seasons.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“He’s got an amazing talent, but it’s the work ethic, dedication and discipline he’s shown to stay at the top for so long. -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;He constantly strives to get better, he’s come back from injury, and he’s never really taken a backward step.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“Obviously he deserves massive credit. But, as a fellow professional and a coach, it’s great to see someone put in that amount of effort. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;It’s brilliant to watch his skills, his determination, his belief and his competitiveness on the field.&#8221;</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 16:45:54 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604061800.jpg?strip=all&w=960","linkMd5":"762daa3ec239eefad18fd7f5851a2e9d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn75@2020_6/2020/08/25/16-46-58-371_2ed272a26a378987.webp","destWidth":960,"destHeight":639,"sourceBytes":111976,"destBytes":111976,"author":"Ian Tuckey","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604061800.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn75@2020_6/2020/08/25/16-46-58-371_2ed272a26a378987.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598374016649},{"createdTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"Hollyoaks’ Lisa Loveday’s explosive final exit will air next month after horror clash with Felix Westwood","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tv/12496492/hollyoaks-lisa-loveday-explosive-final-exit-felix-westwood/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>HOLLYOAKS&#8217; Lisa Loveday&#8217;s explosive&#160;exit will air the first week the soap returns.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The shop assistant &#8211; who is played by actress Rachel Adedeji in the Channel 4 soap since&#160; 2016 &#8211; will be seen for the final time next month after a dramatic clash with secret lover Felix Westwood.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496603\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000587226811.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496603\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Lime Pictures</figcredit></figure>Lisa&#8217;s explosive final scenes will air next month[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Lisa will attend her cousin Mitchell’s wedding to Scott with the whole Deveraux family and will be intent on going public with uncle Felix.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Unbeknown to Lisa, Felix is also dating her aunt, Martine and in a shocking turn of events viewers will see Lisa&#8217;s final moments in the village.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But will Felix keep his secret? Or will someone else discover the relationship?</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Lisa will bow out in the week beginning September 7 when the soap returns with brand new episodes on Channel 4.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496615\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/hollyoaks-felix-1-1587492776.png?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496615\" width=\"960\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Felix will do anything to stop the secret getting out</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496611\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/4_Screen-Shot-2020-04-20-at-192520.png?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496611\" width=\"960\" height=\"540\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">She has been secretly sleeping with her uncle for months</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>A source said: &#8220;Lisa&#8217;s exit has been years in the making and it&#8217;s going to be explosive.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;There&#8217;s a shocking showdown between the Deverauxs.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;Fans are going to be on the edge of their seats to how it all plays out.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Actress Rachel&#8217;s exit was revealed earlier this year however she had told bosses she intended to leave more than a year ago.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Speaking about her exit, Rachel said: &#8220;I have had a fantastic time playing the role of Lisa Loveday.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;I was blessed to have met and worked alongside some of the most talented and professional people during my time on the show.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;Hollyoaks was an amazing opportunity for me to learn and grow as an actress and I am truly grateful.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;As much as I have enjoyed my time on the show, I have chosen to move on. I am looking forward to all opportunities that now await me.”</p>\n\n\n\n\t\t<!-- Start of Brightcove Player -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div style=\"display: block; position: relative; min-width: 0px; performances with superstar charisma.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“I would like to thank Rachel for creating such a memorable and much-loved character.&#160; She will be very much missed.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#160;</p>\n\n\n<div></div>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 16:23:58 Leger","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/horseracing/12487245/antepost-racing-betting-tips-windsor-st-leger/","description":"<p><strong>EACH Monday, we will bring you top antepost tips for the week&#8217;s action with our new column, &#8216;The Early Bird&#8217;.</strong></p>\n<p>More often than not there is some unbelievable value in the bookies&#8217; antepost markets &#8211; so let&#8217;s get on early and catch us some juicy worms.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12487463\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 10px\"><img class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12487463\" src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000602534104.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" width=\"960\" height=\"616\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>PA:Press Association</figcredit></figure></p>\n<p>After a mouthwatering week at York, we are coming back down to earth with something of a bump this week.</p>\n<p>The weekend action isn&#8217;t awful, there are some good races at Goodwood, Windsor and Newmarket.</p>\n<p>But from an antepost perspective there isn&#8217;t a great deal that leaps out in the early markets &#8211; except one horse.</p>\n<p>There is no chance <strong>ALOUNAK (2.40 Windsor Saturday)</strong> goes off 6-1 in the August Stakes on Saturday and those odds should be snapped up.</p>\n<p>\t<div class=\"article-boxout\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\">\n\t\t\t<h3 class=\"article-boxout__headline\">Don&#039;t miss the best of Sun Racing</h3>\n\t\t</div>\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__content theme__background-color-rgba-20\">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__content-img\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/IMG_4681-e1594208722671.jpg?strip=all&&w=576&&h=405&&crop=1\" width=\"576\" height=\"405\" />\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t</p>\n<div>\n<p>Twitter &#8211; <a href=\"https://twitter.com/SunRacing\">@SunRacing</a></p>\n<p>Instagram &#8211; <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/sunracing/?hl=en\">sunracing</a></p>\n<p>Youtube &#8211; <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCMQc2xRG0gRELIFwfw4Pj9A\">SunRacing</a></p>\n<p>Facebook &#8211; <a href=\"https://en-gb.facebook.com/SunRacingOnline/\">SunRacingOnline</a></p>\n</div>\n\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\t</p>\n<p>Andrew Balding&#8217;s charge has become a little disappointing; he should have won plenty more races given his ability.</p>\n<p>But conditions at Windsor this weekend, though currently described as &#8216;Good&#8217;, will deteriorate significantly as there is plenty of rain forecast over the next five days.</p>\n<p>His form figures on &#8216;Soft&#8217; read 1125, with a pair of Listed wins and a fine second in the Hardwicke Stakes at Royal Ascot.</p>\n<p>The only disappointing run came at Newmarket behind <strong>Dame Malliot</strong>, but he was too keen that day and hit the front well over 3f out.</p>\n<p>\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col sun-col-6\">\n\n\t\t\t<div class=\"rail rail--classic  rail--trending theme-sport\" class=\"delayed-image-load-mobile\" data-src=\"https://i0.wp.com/www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/NINTCHDBPICT000457243723-1.jpg?crop=575px%2C477px%2C4568px%2C3045px&#038;resize=300%2C192&#038;ssl=1\"></div>\n\t\t\t</a>\n\t\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail__item-image -->\n\t\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-content\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<h3 class=\"rail__item-headline theme__copy-color\">\n\t\t\t\tGOOD, BAD &#38; UGLY\t\t\t</h3>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"rail__item-sub\">\n\t\t\t\tChappers is back and discusses the big talking points in his latest column\t\t\t</span>\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail__item-content -->\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-gradient-light\">\n\n\t</div>\n\t<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/horseracing/12483205/matt-chapman-column-love-enable/\" class=\"rail__item-anchor\"></a>\n\n</div><!-- .rail__item .swiper-slide -->\n\t\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .swiper-wrapper -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-button-prev theme__background-color-rgba-80\"></div>\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-button-next theme__background-color-rgba-80\"></div>\n\n\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .swiper-container -->\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail .{rail} .swiper-video-rail .{theme-slug} -->\n\n\t\t</div><!-- .col .sun-col-6 -->\n\t</div><!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index-->\n\t</div> <!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t</p>\n<p>He was doing all of his best work late on unsuitable ground at Goodwood last time in a rock-solid Group 3, and this is the first time he has dropped out of Group company since April 2019.</p>\n<p>I would be sceptical that chief market rival<strong> Desert Encounter</strong> will even line up if going conditions ease as expected, <strong>Le Don De Vie</strong> is unlikely to be good enough and there are big stamina doubts around <strong>Fox Tal</strong>.</p>\n<p>If the rainfall that is forecast materialises, the final field will cut up and Alounak (who in truth is the form horse among the entries) will go off favourite, potentially a short one at that. Silvestre De Sousa is already jocked up so it appears it is all systems go for this race.</p>\n<p></p>\n<p>Looking further ahead, it&#8217;ll soon be Donny and the St Leger Festival (how quick has this year gone?).</p>\n<p><strong>Santiago</strong> is an obvious contender and is the one to beat in my opinion, but he is well found at the head of the betting. <strong>Pyledriver</strong> was impressive at York but I think he has a bit too much class and speed for this race and don&#8217;t think a slog over 1m6.5f is what he wants.</p>\n<p>So at longer odds, <strong>MOHICAN HEIGHTS (St Leger Stakes)</strong> tickles my pickle.</p>\n<p>He was impressive in beating good benchmark <strong>Subjectivist</strong> in a Listed race last year and really shaped encouragingly when a staying on third behind Pyledriver in the King Edward at Royal Ascot.</p>\n<p>\t<div class=\"article-boxout\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\">\n\t\t\t<h3 class=\"article-boxout__headline\">The Early Bird - antepost selections and latest odds</h3>\n\t\t</div>\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__content theme__background-color-rgba-20\">\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t<p><b>Saturday</b></p>\n<p>2.40 Windsor &#8211; Alounak 2pts win @ 6-1</p>\n<p><b>St Leger Stakes</b></p>\n<p>Mohican Heights 1pt EW @ 25-1</p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong><em>Latest August P&#38;L: -14 pts</em></strong></li>\n</ul>\n\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\t</p>\n<p>We know the form of that race has worked out well, and David Simcock&#8217;s charge was tapped for a little bit of toe at the top of the straight before galloping strongly through the line.</p>\n<p>He went to the Derby and (like many of them) he was never able to land a blow, particularly after a tardy start. He failed to handle the camber in the straight, too, so you can put a line through that run.</p>\n<p>By stamina-influence Australia, he is related to classy two-miler <strong>Eye Of The Storm</strong> and smart staying handicapper <strong>Curbyourenthusiasm</strong> (who actually won the Mallard over the Leger C&#38;D).</p>\n<p>He will relish a stiff test like the Leger and he handles cut in the ground, a combination which he will likely get if he takes up his entry in the March Stakes this weekend.</p>\n<p>He has only had four starts and there is plenty more to come.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/betting-tips/free-bets\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">SEE ALL FREE BETS HERE</a></p>\n<p>\t\t<!-- Start of Brightcove Player -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div Keene","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000602534104.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn43@2020_3/2020/08/25/16-46-58-476_cdf976cab39d5740.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/IMG_4681-e1594208722671.jpg?strip=all&&w=576&&h=405&&crop=1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn8@2020_1/2020/08/25/16-47-11-597_a98c6e4fa24f3a48.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598374016689},{"createdTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"5pm Arsenal transfer news LIVE: MK Dons friendly TONIGHT, Gabriel IN LONDON, Aubameyang  ‘contract THIS WEEK’","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12116744/arsenal-transfer-news-live-gabriel-magalhaes-coutinho-aubameyang-contract/","description":"<p><b>GABRIEL MAGALHAES has landed in London to complete his move to Arsenal, according to reports.</b></p>\n<p>And in more good news, the Gunners are said to believe they&#8217;ll be able to announce a new deal for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang this week.</p>\n<p><em>Get all the latest news and transfer gossip from North London here&#8230;</em></p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 16:23:52 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"7366a4b57ec3908dafaed0608cc75033","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"sstreet","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598374016681},{"createdTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"Horrifying testing lab where monkeys screamed in pain during barbaric tests is allowed to stay OPEN","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12495316/horrifying-testing-lab-monkeys-allowed-open/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>A HELLISH animal testing laboratory in Germany that animal rights groups fought to close last year due to its barbaric conditions has been allowed to stay open. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Shocking images and videos seeped from the Laboratory of Pharmacology and Toxicology (LPT) last year, revealing the horrific living conditions of the monkeys, cats, dogs and rabbits that were tortured daily. </p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495907\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604014947.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495907\" width=\"960\" height=\"544\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Cruelty Free International and SOKO Tierschutz/Newsflash</figcredit></figure>The facility sent shockwaves across the world after disturbing images of screaming monkeys were revealed [/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495966\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 730px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000530866601.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=720\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495966\" width=\"720\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Central European News</figcredit></figure>This Beagle looks miserable and in pain as it sits on the blood-soaked floor[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495971\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000530866666.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495971\" width=\"960\" height=\"706\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Central European News</figcredit></figure>A row of monkeys are held by their necks [/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>One of the most distressing images to emerge from the vile facility in <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/where/germany/\">Hamburg</a> was of a group of monkeys chained to the wall by a metal neck brace.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The helpless creatures were known to scream in agony as the tests were carried out.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Other images saw cats and dogs left bleeding and left to die in their own filth following toxicity testing.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>According to Cruelty Free International (CFI), tests were carried out for companies around the world. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>They included poisoning vulnerable animals to see how much of the chemical their bodies could take before serious harm was caused.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The harrowing footage secretly captured in the lab sparked international outrage and an official investigation was launched in October last year. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>CFI revealed last year that 49 cats and 80 dogs were saved from the facility.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The animals were transferred to animal welfare organisations or to private homes for adoption.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Following a police investigation, last year,  LPT was given a period of two weeks to hand over all the animals at the testing lab to third parties. </p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t<blockquote class=\"article__quote\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article__quote-copy theme__before-color theme__after-color\">\n\t\t\t<p>You should stop torturing animals!! Stop now !!</p>\n\t\t\t\t<cite class=\"article__quote-credit theme__copy-color\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"quote-credit\">Isabelle Kronenberger</span>\t\t\t\t</cite>\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t</blockquote>\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>But tragically, despite animal rights groups&#8217; best efforts &#8211; the lab, just outside Hamburg in the Neu Wulmstorf district of Mienenbuettel, in Lower Saxony, has now been allowed to resume operations following a ruling from a Hamburg court.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Friedrich Mulln from Soko Tierschutz told German newspaper Tag24: &#8220;It is a scandal that Hamburg is apparently being appeased by cheap personnel damage from the LPT and not even waiting for the criminal proceedings, in particular, because of allegedly falsified animal research studies for over a decade.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>A <a href=\"https://www.change.org/u/1021374687\">petition</a> to close the lab has collected 1,218,129 signatures. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>In the comment section, one wrote: &#8220;Let it stop, why do animals always have to suffer?</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Another wrote: &#8220;Animals are tortured for our purposes and often die in agony. I think we have no right to do that and there are good alternatives that make this unnecessary.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;There doesn&#8217;t have to be anything like that in our highly developed society!&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Katja Noske, who signed the protest wrote: &#8220;It cannot be that the madness continues!&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<h2>LET IT STOP</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>One said: &#8220;Animal testing is completely unnecessary!&#160;Stop torturing poor and innocent creatures for drugs that won&#8217;t work on humans anyway!&#160;There are alternatives to animal testing!&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The Hamburg Higher Administrative Court allowed operations at the Hamburg location again in mid-July. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Nevertheless, the LPT initially did not resume operations and is now allowed to do so, subject to conditions.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>According to the judicial authorities, a new managing director, a new animal welfare officer and new animal researcher have been appointed at LPT.</p>\n\n\n\n<h2>&#8216;MADNESS&#8217;</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>Mulln also said that it showed that in Hamburg &#8220;profit from outdated animal experiments takes precedence over the protection of people and animals&#8221;.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Hamburg&#8217;s Justice and Consumer Protection Senator Anna Gallina (Greens) has announced that she plans to work for more animal welfare at a federal level. She said: &#8220;Improvements in the protection of laboratory animals are urgently needed and long overdue.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Hamburg&#8217;s Justice and Consumer Protection Senator Anna Gallina (Greens) announced a Federal Council initiative in which the Hanseatic city wants to campaign for more animal welfare at the federal level.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div of laboratory animals are urgently needed and long overdue,&#8221; said the Senator.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Animal experiments should generally be avoided as far as possible.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Significantly more and unannounced controls should take place and companies should be obliged to promote alternatives to animal testing.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure practices[/caption]\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 15:45:13 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"Shoppers are snapping up massive DW Sports sales hauls – including £361 of Nike trainers & Adidas tracksuits for £45","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/fabulous/12494996/shoppers-massive-dw-sports-sales-hauls-including-361-of-nike-trainers-adidas-tracksuits/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>IF you&#8217;re looking to upgrade your workout gear, or just love a good bargain, then you better head down to DW Sports &#8211; and make it quick. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Shoppers have been snapping up a range of branded goods &#8211; including Nike, Adidas and Puma &#8211; for a fraction of the price as the sporting retailer offers up to 80% off. </p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495792\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 754px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604044360.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=744\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495792\" width=\"744\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Extreme Couponing and Bargains UK</figcredit></figure>One shopper spent just £45 on all of this, which should have set her back £361[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>The sports retailer announced it was <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/money/12298471/dw-sports-administration-jobs-at-risk/#:~:text=DW%20Sports%20said%20it%20will,at%20its%2050%20remaining%20stores.&#38;text=Visitors%20to%20DW%20Sports'%20website,%22temporarily%20offline%20for%20maintenance%22.\">going into administration</a>, with over 25 stores across the UK already closing its doors. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>The rest are set to close in the coming weeks and shoppers have been scrambling to get their hands on the remaining stock &#8211; which has all been heavily discounted.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Some have been showing off their massive hauls online, sharing snaps their new sports gear in the <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/groups/ExtremeCouponingAndBargainsUK/\">Extreme Couponing and Bargains UK group</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>One thrilled shopper shared a snap of not one, but six pairs of new kicks from brands such as Nike, Puma, Adidas and Sketchers &#8211; and revealed that she bagged £361 worth of items for a tiny £45. </p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495932\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 536px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604049482.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=526\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495932\" width=\"526\" height=\"701\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Extreme Couponing and Bargains UK</figcredit></figure>One woman picked up these bargains for just £38, despite the shoes alone costing £140[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495841\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 730px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604047537.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=720\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495841\" width=\"720\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Extreme Couponing and Bargains UK</figcredit></figure>Another snapped up a huge box full of branded goods at a heavily discounted price[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495844\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 730px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604047531.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=720\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495844\" width=\"720\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Extreme Couponing and Bargains UK</figcredit></figure>All DW Stores are selling off the remaining items at 80% off with bargain-hunters lining up for a piece of the action[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>She wrote: &#8220;DW sports are closing down (sports direct taking over apparently) this all had £361 tag prices. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;Closing down sale is 80% off we went in with £50 cash (it was cash only there as they had no tills now) we came out with £5. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;They are working at 80% but clearly just rounding it down or making it up. I know a lot would of emptied today but worth a look. No receipt due to them not having tills.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Elsewhere, another shopper spent just £115 on a huge selection of sporting goods for her family and revealed it should have cost her a whopping £750. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Sharing snaps of her massive haul laid out nicely on the floor, she wrote: &#8220;Our bargains from DW Sports. Should have cost £750, paid £115.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_undefined\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 10px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000599828576.jpg?strip=all\" alt=\"Sports retailer and gym group DW Sports is set to fall into administration\" class=\"alignnone\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Sports retailer and gym group DW Sports is set to fall into administration</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;We live in Wigan (hence the Latics stuff, my Dads a big fan), got a sports mad daughter, a 14 year old son and I’ve just joined the gym so definitely came at the right time!!!&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Meanwhile, one woman managed to pick up a new swimsuit, a pair of swimming goggles, some trainers and a couple of pairs of joggers for just £38 &#8211; when the Brooks trainers alone should have set her back £140. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>It seems the bargains are only available in store as many people have pointed out, causing eager shoppers to desperately hunt down their closest store. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>But with plans to shut its doors for good, you best head to DW Sports quickly to avoid missing out on these amazing mark downs. </p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"Hillary Clinton tells Biden ‘not to concede under any circumstances’ even if he’s losing on election night","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12496294/hillary-clinton-biden-not-concede-any-circumstances/","description":"<p><strong>FORMER Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton has said current candidate Joe Biden &#8220;should not concede under any circumstances&#8221; in the fall election.</strong></p>\n<p>A new interview with the former first lady reveals that Clinton believes the final results for the November election will be dragged out, <a href=\"https://thehill.com/homenews/media/513527-hillary-clinton-biden-should-not-concede-under-any-circumstances\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">The Hill reported</a> on Tuesday.</p>\n<p><strong><strong><img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/26a0.png\" alt=\"⚠\" class=\"wp-smiley\" style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 1em;\" /></strong></strong> <strong>Follow our<a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/news/1186278/us-election-2020-trump-biden-latest-news/\"> US election 2020 live blog </a>for the latest news &#38; updates</strong> </p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12496546\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603122974.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496546\" width=\"960\" height=\"541\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Alamy Live News</figcredit></figure>Hillary Clinton believes the final results for the November election will be dragged out[/caption]</p>\n<p>&#8220;I do believe he will win if we don&#8217;t give an inch and if we are as focused and relentless as the other side is,&#8221; she said in the interview with The Cirus on Showtime.</p>\n<p>&#8220;I think that [Republicans] have a couple of scenarios that they are looking toward,&#8221; Clinton said. &#8220;One is messing up absentee balloting.</p>\n<p>&#8220;They believe that helps them so that they then get maybe a narrow advantage in the Electoral College on Election Day. </p>\n<p>&#8220;So we&#8217;ve got to have a massive legal operation, and I know the Biden campaign is working on that.&#8221; </p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12496547\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603196789-1.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496547\" width=\"960\" height=\"656\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>AFP or licensors</figcredit></figure>Clinton advises BJoe iden not to concede in the fall election[/caption]</p>\n<p>On Tuesday morning, President Donald Trump <a href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1298256297431666688\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">tweeted</a> that is is &#8220;unfair&#8221; for the <a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/where/united-states/\">United States</a> to be sending &#8220;80 million unsolicited ballots.&#8221;</p>\n<p>He called it a &#8220;roadmap to disaster.&#8221;</p>\n<p>&#8220;Even recent small and easier to control elections which did this are a catastrophic disaster,&#8221; the tweet continued. &#8220;Fraudulent &#38; missing Ballots like never seen before. 20% and 30% off. STOP!&#8221;</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/who/donald-trump/\">Trump</a> has <a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/news/1346782/trump-accuses-democrats-steal-2020-election-mail-voting/\">routinely raged against mail-in voting</a>, often calling it a “scam” to influence the election in favor of <a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/topic/democratic-party/\">Democrats</a>.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12496461\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.the-sun.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603892680.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496461\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>AFP or licensors</figcredit></figure>President Donald Trump has called mail-in voting a &#8216;scam&#8217;[/caption]</p>\n<p>He has made the issue of mail-in voting and supposed “voter fraud” one of the cornerstone messages of his campaign.</p>\n<p>In <a href=\"https://www.the-sun.com/where/north-carolina/\">Charlotte, North Carolina</a>, on Monday, the president talked about the issue of “harvesting” votes or “ballot collection” where a third party collects and submits the votes of others.</p>\n<p>He told his supporters in Charlotte that Democrats will harvest votes and stop those from Republican voters from being processed and counted.</p>\n<p>\t\t<!-- Start of Brightcove Player -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div style=\"display: block; position: relative; min-width: 0px; max-width: 640px;\">\n\t\t\t\t<div style=\"padding-top: 56%; voting which he believes is vulnerable to fraud calling it “greatest scam in the history of politics.”</p>\n<p>“In a very nice way, I will tell you, they are trying to steal the election just like they did it last time with spying and we caught them,&#8221; he said. </p>\n<p>Trump <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/08/19/903886567/trump-while-attacking-mail-voting-casts-mail-ballot-again\" injury","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/horseracing/12494122/mohaather-retired-due-to-injury/","description":"<p><strong>TRAINER Marcus Tregoning has been dealt a huge blow as his star miler Mohaather has been forced into an early retirement.</strong></p>\n<p>The four-year-old was found to have suffered &#8220;significant bone bruising&#8221; in his near hind fetlock, ending his racing career with immediate effect.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_12494177\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img class=\"size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12494177\" src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000598872521.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" width=\"960\" height=\"575\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Mohaather has been retired due to injury</figcaption><figcredit>PA:Press Association</figcredit></figure></p>\n<p>The Sheikh Hamdan Al Maktoum-owned colt was a brilliant winner of the Sussex Stakes at Glorious Goodwood where he beat the likes of <strong>Circus Maximus</strong>, <strong>Siskin</strong> and <strong>Kameko</strong>.</p>\n<p>He was being prepared for the Queen Elizabeth II Stakes on British Champions Day with the possibility of continuing next year as a five-year-old, but those plans have been scuppered.</p>\n<p>Tregoning said: &#8220;It&#8217;s a blow, but the horse retires intact &#8211; that&#8217;s the main thing.</p>\n<p>&#8220;The Goodwood win was fantastic. If he couldn&#8217;t get the win at Royal Ascot, to beat two Guineas winners and the Queen Anne winner in the Sussex Stakes was brilliant.</p>\n<p>\t<div class=\"article-boxout\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\">\n\t\t\t<h3 class=\"article-boxout__headline\">Don&#039;t miss the best of Sun Racing</h3>\n\t\t</div>\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__content theme__background-color-rgba-20\">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__content-img\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/IMG_4681-e1594208722671.jpg?strip=all&&w=576&&h=405&&crop=1\" width=\"576\" height=\"405\" />\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t</p>\n<div>\n<p>Twitter &#8211; <a href=\"https://twitter.com/SunRacing\">@SunRacing</a></p>\n<p>Instagram &#8211; <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/sunracing/?hl=en\">sunracing</a></p>\n<p>Youtube &#8211; <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCMQc2xRG0gRELIFwfw4Pj9A\">SunRacing</a></p>\n<p>Facebook &#8211; <a href=\"https://en-gb.facebook.com/SunRacingOnline/\">SunRacingOnline</a></p>\n</div>\n\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\t</p>\n<p>&#8220;When you watch it again, he had to pull round them all, giving away three lengths &#8211; and he still absolutely hammered them.</p>\n<p>&#8220;He was a very good horse, and we were incredibly lucky to have had him. I don&#8217;t think I&#8217;ve seen one &#8211; in my time anyway, including my time with Dick Hern &#8211; with two bursts of electric speed. I haven&#8217;t seen that before.</p>\n<p>&#8220;He also got the mile really well, yet he had a sprinter&#8217;s turn of foot. We actually tried to get Dayjur to stay a mile, because commercially they are more valuable and there are so many sprinters standing at stud. In his case, it didn&#8217;t work.</p>\n<p>&#8220;We followed the same path with this horse, knowing we could drop back to sprinting if we had to, but he proved he could get the trip really well &#8211; and he was never stopping at the end of a mile.&#8221;</p>\n<p>Mohaather won the Greenham Stakes on his first three-year-old start, but had to miss the 2019 2000 Guineas after a setback. His win in the Sussex was a first Group 1 for Tregoning since <strong>Sir Percy</strong> won the Derby in 2006.</p>\n<p></p>\n<p>Tregoning added: &#8220;He was a very exciting horse, but now he has to go on to father lots of fast children, hopefully. It would be nice if we get one or two, but time marches on. and now we have to find the next one &#8211; hopefully we still will.&#8221;</p>\n<p>&#8220;He was exceptional, we know that. He was a lovely horse to train, easy at home and gave his best every time &#8211; a dream to train.</p>\n<p>&#8220;It was just a shame because we would have loved to have trained him next year, but now that&#8217;s not going to happen.&#8221;</p>\n<p>Mohaather had been 10-3 for the QEII with Coral, who have reacted by cutting the unbeaten<strong> Palace Pier</strong> into even-money favourite from 6-4.</p>\n<p>Coral&#8217;s David Stevens said: &#8220;Mohaather was one of the stars of this season following his thrilling Sussex Stakes win, and his clash with Palace Pier amongst others in the Queen Elizabeth II Stakes promised so much.</p>\n<p>&#8220;His premature retirement is sad for the colt&#8217;s connections and race fans in general, and leaves Palace Pier as a warm favourite for the Champions day contest.&#8221;</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/betting-tips/free-bets\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">SEE ALL FREE BETS HERE</a></p>\n<p>\t\t<!-- Start of Keene","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000598872521.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn68@2020_2/2020/08/25/16-46-58-680_a37242d6554ff6c3.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/IMG_4681-e1594208722671.jpg?strip=all&&w=576&&h=405&&crop=1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn8@2020_1/2020/08/25/16-47-11-597_a98c6e4fa24f3a48.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598374016683},{"createdTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"Sheridan Smith fights back tears and says she’s ‘scared’ her mental health problems will return in Becoming Mum","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/12495274/sheridan-smith-tears-mental-health/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>SHERIDAN Smith breaks down in tears in her emotional new series as she admits she&#8217;s scared about being a mother.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The 39-year-old actress, who said <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/12489563/sheridan-smith-almost-died-humiliation-graham-norton-baftas/\">she nearly died after the 2016 Baftas</a> when host Graham Norton mocked her, opens up in ITV&#8217;s Becoming Mum.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495484\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 918px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/a7c70e4a-d2e5-4c51-b857-5c53d3b73fcd.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=908\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495484\" width=\"908\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>ITV</figcredit></figure>Sheridan Smith breaks down in a new trailer for her ITV documentary[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>A heartbreaking new trailer sees Sheridan, who became a parent in May this year, speak about her fears.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Showing her before she gave birth, the star tells viewers: &#8220;No one knows what&#8217;s going on behind it all.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;The biggest worry is you&#8217;ve had mental health issues in the past &#8211; will it rear its ugly head again?</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;Now I&#8217;m pregnant it feels like I&#8217;ve got a second chance at life.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495554\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/c678ed87-72d6-4af1-8e29-f00cf9f0eaaa.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495554\" width=\"960\" height=\"952\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>ITV</figcredit></figure>The actress is shown dabbing her eyes with a tissue in a new trailer[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12490824\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/02a5bc89-ab65-4afc-84d2-8192048044dd.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12490824\" width=\"960\" height=\"663\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>ITV</figcredit></figure>Sheridan reveals her agony as she becomes a mum to son Billy[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;So many women out there who are just as scared as me and we need to get some answers.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The star of Cilla and Gavin &#38; Stacey gave producers exclusive access to her life in the four months up to the birth of son Billy in May.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She and fiancé Jamie Horn, 31, had to scrap plans for a natural birth as Billy arrived early, forcing Sheridan to have an emergency caesarean section.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The documentary sees Sheridan having therapy for the first time, to explore issues which she believes could stem from her childhood and the death of her sibling when he was 18 and she was eight.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495896\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/vlcsnap-2020-08-25-16h00m51s358.png?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495896\" width=\"960\" height=\"540\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">She is shown clasping her face during an ultrasound scan with Jamie Horn</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495618\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/9c7aabca-72f4-4417-90cf-46576fc33aca.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495618\" width=\"960\" height=\"806\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>ITV</figcredit></figure>She is seen going into therapy for the first time to explore issues from childhood[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>She is seen crying and asks the crew to stop filming as she says: “It was all perfect until my brother Julian got unwell.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;He was diagnosed with cancer and spent a couple of years on the couch unwell. I’d do little performances for him. He’d encourage me to sing and dance for him and I’d massage his feet.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Sheridan also opens up about her nightmare at the Bafta in 2016</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Fighting back tears, Sheridan, 39, recalls: “<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/who/graham-norton/\">Graham Norton</a>&#160;was hosting and made a joke, basically at my expense, about me being a drunk.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495561\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/c060c684-c2a5-4313-93ed-122ddae3b659.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495561\" width=\"960\" height=\"758\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>ITV</figcredit></figure>The star explains: &#8216;No one knows what&#8217;s going on behind it all&#8217;[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495531\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/vlcsnap-2020-08-25-15h28m47s535.png?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495531\" width=\"960\" height=\"540\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>ITV</figcredit></figure>Sheridan is seen smiling as she hangs out with fellow mums at a group[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>“I was so humiliated, you know, it’s a room full of your peers. And people you want to work with, or have worked with.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“That night for me was like the final straw, before my brain totally went off the deep end.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>At the time, Sheridan’s West End production of Funny Girl was halted due to “technical difficulties”.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Some fans believed it was down to her drinking after she reportedly slurred lines — unaware she was heartbroken that her father, Colin, had been diagnosed with cancer.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495820\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/227d16d0-33c6-44fd-805d-83b2a32cb435.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495820\" width=\"960\" height=\"809\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Her doc Sheridan Smith: Becoming Mum airs on Tuesday next week</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12489724\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000460707508.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12489724\" width=\"960\" height=\"639\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>ITV</figcredit></figure>Sheridan, pictured as Sam in Cleaning Up, reveals she was rushed to hospital[/caption]\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>Launching the awards show, BBC chat star Norton said: “Let’s get started because, of course, the sooner we begin, the sooner we can have a couple of drinks . . . or as they say in theatrical circles, a couple of glasses of technical difficulties.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The actress and singer said that swipe tipped her over the edge. She added: “What people didn’t realise was that I’d become addicted to anti-anxiety tablets.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“That night, I took myself off to a hotel on my own. In my crazy mind I thought, ‘I don’t wanna be in rehab — I’ll do it myself’ so I went there and I just stopped my tablets.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“What I didn’t realise is, that if you stop the tablets abruptly, you seizure. And, to cut a long story short, I got seizures five times and got rushed into A&#38;E.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><strong>Sheridan&#160;Smith: Becoming Mum is on Tuesday 1st September at 9pm on deal so she can share her organising and crafting tips</a>, has already been discussing ideas with Sophie.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Trained hairdresser and influencer Sophie, who has a huge following thanks to her own cleaning hacks, would love to work with Stacey too.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>A source told <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/newmagazineuk/\">new!</a> magazine: &#8220;Stacey is very keen to do lots in the cleaning influencer field.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;She could bring out her new books and range of cleaning products and supplies if she wants to.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495266\" the term &#8216;Tap To Tidy&#8217; in April, after delighting fans with Instagram videos of messy rooms being transformed into tidy ones. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>She has apparently done the same for My Little Pickle, the nickname she has given to her one-year-old son Rex.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495389\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img is in a relationship with Joe Swash, is a proud mum of three sons[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Stacey found fame aged just 19 when she appeared on The X Factor. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>A teen mum-of-one at the time, she came second in the 2009 series and has since gone on to forge a hugely successful career in the entertainment industry. </p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/2190257/stacey-solomon-joe-swash-kids-net-worth/\">Stacey </a>is now a popular Loose Women panelist and has her own line of children&#8217;s wear with high street chain Primark. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>The mum-of-three, who is in a long-term relationship with Joe Swash, has also amassed a whopping 3.7 million followers on Instagram.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure HERE FOR ALL THE LATEST CELTIC, RANGERS AND PREMIERSHIP NEWS</a></h2>\n<hr />\n<p>&#160;</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 16:10:35 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"a43b67970f7da3a6a3b39791d72df4cc","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"James Orr","publishedOrCreatedDate":1598374016660},{"createdTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"Philippe Coutinho wants Premier League transfer over Barcelona return with Man Utd, Arsenal and Chelsea keen","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12495573/coutinho-man-utd-arsenal-chelsea-transfer-barcelona/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>PHILIPPE COUTINHO would prefer to head back to the Premier League rather than return to Barcelona &#8211; with Manchester United, Arsenal and Chelsea keen, according to reports.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The Brazilian&#8217;s loan at Bayern Munich has come to an end after the Champions League winners opted against exercising their option buy him.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496017\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603668982.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496017\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>Coutinho wants to head back to the Premier League, with Man Utd, Chelsea and Arsenal keen[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Coutinho is now set to return to parent-club <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/team/1232720/barcelona/\">Barcelona</a> for showdown talks with new boss Ronald Koeman.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But <a href=\"https://www.marca.com/en/football/barcelona/2020/08/25/5f42bdbdca47415b4b8b4583.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Marca</a> claim the &#8220;Little Magician&#8221;, 28, would rather go back to England, with a host of top clubs interested.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/who/philippe-coutinho/\">Coutinho</a> has three years left to run on his current contract at Barcelona.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>It&#8217;s claimed Koeman does not see the former Liverpool midfielder in his future plans and will push to sell him, much <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12491242/luis-suarez-barcelona-exit-koeman/\">like Luis Suarez</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But very few clubs are likely to take on Coutinho&#8217;s £240,000-a-week wages, particularly in the current climate.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Barcelona could therefore offer the Brazil star to clubs for much less than his market value in order to tempt potential suitors into a deal.</p>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"wp-block-group\"><div class=\"wp-block-group__inner-container\">\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n\n\n\n<h2><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12371286/transfer-news-live-winks-man-city-cristiano-ronaldo-barcelona-spurs-liverpool/\">TRANSFER NEWS LIVE: Breaking news, juicy gossip and the biggest deals</a></h2>\n\n\n\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n</div></div>\n\n\n\n<p>Man Utd, Chelsea and Arsenal have all registered their interest during the summer, while Newcastle were linked with a move before their takeover collapsed.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Coutinho &#8211; who cost Barca £142million from Liverpool in January 2018 &#8211; has been <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12482810/philippe-coutinho-transfer-news-barcelona-arsenal-bayern-munich/\">tight-lipped regarding his future</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>After helping Bayern to the Champions League trophy, he said: &#8220;Of course, I have to go back to Barcelona and then we&#8217;ll see what happens.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;I haven&#8217;t really thought about it much, I&#8217;ve only been focused on the final.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;What I can say is that I really want to work hard to have a great year, but let&#8217;s see what happens.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Coutinho not only cost Barcelona a staggering amount up front and through his astronomical wages, but he also <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12410187/barcelona-pay-liverpool-bayern-munich-win-champions-league/\">forced the club into paying Liverpool a further £4.5m</a> on Sunday.</p>\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/AF-OFF-PLATFORM-TRANSFERS-COSTS-lukaku-v2.jpg\"><img class=\"alignnone wp-image-9686918 size-thesun-article-image\" src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/AF-OFF-PLATFORM-TRANSFERS-COSTS-lukaku-v2.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\"></a></p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>On trying to sign Coutinho, the LaLiga giants included a host of future incentives to tempt Jurgen Klopp into selling.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>One of those add-ons saw Barcelona forced to pay <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/team/1196659/liverpool/\">Liverpool</a> £4.5m if <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/who/philippe-coutinho/\">Coutinho</a> ever wins the Champions League while on the books of the Nou Camp.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But bizarrely, the deal never specified as to which club &#8211; and after helping Bayern to the title, the Reds pocketed a tidy sum.</p>\n\n\n\n\t\t<!-- Start of Brightcove Player -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div style=\"display: block; position: relative; min-width: 0px; max-width: 640px;\">\n\t\t\t\t<div style=\"padding-top: 56%; +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603668982.jpg?strip=all&w=960","linkMd5":"dd7843dd79564d80b56e1899b3473471","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn27@2020_3/2020/08/25/16-46-57-101_c7a9e914c6bb03f4.webp","destWidth":960,"destHeight":640,"sourceBytes":119036,"destBytes":119036,"author":"Dave Fraser","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603668982.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn27@2020_3/2020/08/25/16-46-57-101_c7a9e914c6bb03f4.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/AF-OFF-PLATFORM-TRANSFERS-COSTS-lukaku-v2.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn59@2020_6/2020/08/25/16-47-11-278_1586c575ee22af7c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598374016683},{"createdTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"Teen ‘kills her mum and lives with rotting corpse in bathtub for MONTHS until neighbours complained of unbearable smell’","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/worldnews/12466881/teen-kills-mum-lives-corpse-bathtub-months-complained-smell/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>A TEENAGER is accused of killing her mum and living with the corpse in the bathtub for four months as neighbours reported an &#8220;unbearable&#8221; smell.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Police discovered the 45-year-old mum&#8217;s mummified body in a bath at a flat in l&#8217;Alcudia de Crespins, southern <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/where/spain/\">Spain. </a></p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12467386\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 820px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603302819.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=810\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12467386\" width=\"810\" height=\"539\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>The Olive Press</figcredit></figure>Teen Teri, right, is accused of killing her mum Ana, left, during the height of Spain&#8217;s coronavirus lockdown in April[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496620\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603973769.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496620\" width=\"960\" height=\"567\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Newsflash</figcredit></figure>19-year-old Teri is arrested by the Spanish Civil Guard[/caption]\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12467385\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603303502.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12467385\" width=\"960\" height=\"720\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Facebook</figcredit></figure>Police allegedly discovered 45-year-old Ana&#8217;s body in a bathtub after neighbours complained of the smell[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Officers believe the woman, named locally as Ana, was stabbed in April, when residents were confined to their homes during the <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/topic/coronavirus/\">coronavirus </a>lockdown.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Her 19-year-old daughter, Teri, continued to live in the apartment alongside her mother&#8217;s body, it is alleged.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Neighbours said there was a &#8216;vile stench&#8217; around the four-storey block of flats.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>However, they didn&#8217;t suspect the smell was from a body that was decomposing in one of the flats, the&#160;<a href=\"https://www.theolivepress.es/spain-news/2020/08/21/teenager-kills-her-mother-and-leaves-body-to-rot-in-bathtub-for-four-months-on-spains-costa-blanca/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Olive Press</a>&#160;reported.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>It&#8217;s understood Teri and her boyfriend, 19, have been arrested and are due to be charged in the death of her mum, who worked as a cleaner and carer.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The young couple had been staying with the divorced mum-of-two, but neighbours often heard them rowing, according to reports.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Cops were finally called to the flat after Teri allegedly confessed to her male friend that she had fatally stabbed her mum.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He alerted police on Wednesday, and officers discovered the victim&#8217;s remains when they entered the flat on Thursday morning.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Due to the mummified condition of the body, a coroner was unable to determine the exact date of Ana&#8217;s death.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But the Olive Press and&#160;<a href=\"https://www.lasprovincias.es/ribera-costera/hallan-muerta-signos-20200820180146-nt.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Las Provincias</a>&#160;reported that the mum died in April.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Teri then lived with the corpse for four months despite the stench of rotting flesh, it is claimed.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Ana was a Bulgarian national who had lived in the area for 20 years.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Neighbours told&#160;<a href=\"https://www.elespanol.com/reportajes/20200820/teri-convivido-cadaver-madre-semana-junto-novio/514449742_0.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">El Espanol</a>&#160;of their shock after the corpse was discovered.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>They said they asked Teri where her mum was, and the teen told them she would return in a few days.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>One neighbour said: &#8220;At the end, the daughter was busy cleaning the stairs.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;A neighbour asked her about her mother and she told him that she would return in a few days.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col sun-col-6\">\n\n\t\t\t<div class=\"rail rail--classic  rail--trending theme-news\" data-slide-count=\"4\" data-slide-count-tablet=\"4\">\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-container\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div midfielder","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12495553/smith-rowe-arsenal-transfer-monaco-leeds/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>MONACO have been rebuffed in a bid for Arsenal youngster Emile Smith Rowe, according to reports.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The attacking midfielder spent time on loan at Huddersfield last year before a fresh crack at the Gunners&#8217; first-team.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496003\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 10px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/crop-12495988.jpg?strip=all\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone wp-image-12496003\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty - Contributor</figcredit></figure>Emile Smith Rowe is wanted by Monaco and a handful of Premier League clubs[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Mikel Arteta began to cast his eye over Smith Rowe when pre-season training began on Monday.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The <a href=\"https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-8661797/Arsenal-knock-Monaco-approach-Emile-Smith-Rowe.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\">Mail</a> report on Monaco&#8217;s early approach being rejected with Arsenal rating the 20-year-old at between £10million and £15m.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Leeds and Fulham are also named as interested parties in a loan deal for Smith Rowe.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>While his hometown club Crystal Palace have made their interest in a permanent deal known.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.football.london/arsenal-fc/transfer-news/arsenal-transfer-news-smith-rowe-18724577\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\">Football.London</a> believe the club have told Smith Rowe he will be in Arteta&#8217;s squad for the start of the coming season.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Having impressed in cup competitions for Arsenal across the last two campaigns, he has <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/11383674/arsenal-smith-rowe-fit-huddersfield/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">accrued experience with Huddersfield</a> and German club RB Leipzig.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And Arteta recently declared: &#8220;I am excited to work with him.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;I have been talking with him and I have followed him during his spell on loan. I think he&#8217;s someone who can be pretty impressive.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/AD-SPORT-GRAPHIC-Arsenal-Top-Fixtures-2.jpg\"><img -->\n\t\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-content\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<h3 class=\"rail__item-headline theme__copy-color\">\n\t\t\t\tHARRY IN\t\t\t</h3>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"rail__item-anchor\"></a>\n\n</div><!-- .rail__item .swiper-slide -->\n\t\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .swiper-wrapper -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-button-prev .swiper-video-rail .{theme-slug} -->\n\n\t\t</div><!-- .col .sun-col-6 -->\n\t</div><!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index-->\n\t</div> <!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>A huge squad overhaul is underway at Emirates Stadium which may promote Smith Rowe closer to the starting XI.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Incomings have been the order of the day so far with Willian in the bag, Cedric Soares and Pablo Mari&#8217;s loans being made permanent, and Gabriel Magalhaes <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12490696/arsenal-transfer-gabriel-magalhaes-agent/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">on the way</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Alexandre Lacazette may be allowed to leave for £30m while Matteo Guendouzi and Mesut Ozil <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12417784/arsenal-transfer-news-matteo-guendouzi-villareal-unai-emery-arteta/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">are thought to be up for sale</a>, along with Wolves-bound Ainsley Maitland-Niles.</p>\n\n\n\n<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/SPORTS-GRAPHIC-BIGGEST-SALES-ARSENAL.jpg\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/SPORTS-GRAPHIC-BIGGEST-SALES-ARSENAL.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12277306\"
