-->\n\n\t\t\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 15:15:12 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/crop-12495988.jpg?strip=all","linkMd5":"d57e77bcc6372835ec66547f3af2513a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn47@2020_5/2020/08/25/16-46-58-803_c8a60a84c2a954f1.webp","destWidth":1473,"destHeight":981,"sourceBytes":136728,"destBytes":136728,"author":"Marc Mayo","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/crop-12495988.jpg?strip=all":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn47@2020_5/2020/08/25/16-46-58-803_c8a60a84c2a954f1.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/AD-SPORT-GRAPHIC-Arsenal-Top-Fixtures-2.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn58@2020_6/2020/08/25/16-47-01-066_8873eb7225d10739.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/SPORTS-GRAPHIC-BIGGEST-SALES-ARSENAL.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn11@2020_1/2020/08/25/16-47-07-682_5ba09ff76c9b6681.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598374016685},{"createdTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"New Call of Duty Black Ops Cold War game revealed TOMORROW – everything we know so far","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/12494871/call-of-duty-black-ops-cold-war-release-date-trailer-warzone-plot-story/","description":"<p>CALL of Duty is getting a brand new game tomorrow – as fans of the epic shooter await a major reveal.</p> \n<p>Activision will show off the new Call of Duty Black Ops Cold War, before its release later this year.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12495370\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-190.png?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495370\" width=\"960\" height=\"537\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Activision\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Black Ops: Cold War is the official title for the next Call of Duty game[/caption] \n<h2>Call of Duty 2020 – what is it?</h2> \n<p>Just like Christmas, Call of Duty arrives each year to the delight of gamers.</p> \n<p>And 2020 is no different: Activision has confirmed that we have a new Call of Duty to look forward to this year.</p> \n<p>The new game is named Call of Duty Black Ops Cold War.</p> \n<p>It’s expected to run on the PS4, Xbox One, PC and the upcoming PS5 and Xbox Series X.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12495398\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 760px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-191.png?strip=all&amp;w=750\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495398\" width=\"750\" height=\"522\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Activision\n </figcredit>\n</figure>The trailer used real footage of an actual interview with KGB defector Yuri Bezmenov[/caption] \n<h2>Call of Duty 2020 release date – when is it out?</h2> \n<p>Activision has already been heavily teasing the game, and will host a major reveal on Wednesday, August 26.</p> \n<p>Interestingly, this reveal is set to take place in Verdansk.</p> \n<p>Call of Duty Modern Warfare players will be familiar with Verdansk as the home of Warzone, the popular Battle Royale spin-off game.</p> \n<p>Rival title Fortnite regularly makes big announcements in-game, so it’s no surprise that Call of Duty is following suit.</p> \n<p>Sadly, we don’t have an exact release date beyond ‘2020’ for the new Call of Duty game.</p> \n<p>According to Activision, this is despite the ongoing global health crisis – which has created “challenges” for developers.</p> \n<p>“The shift to remote working does add complexity in some areas of the game development process,” Activision’s COO Daniel Alegre said.</p> \n<p>“We are implementing mitigation measures to address each of these areas.</p> \n<p>“This includes the next premium release of Call of Duty.”</p> \n<p>Usually Call of Duty games come out around October or November time, so expect a similar pre-Christmas launch for 2020.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12495408\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-192.png?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495408\" width=\"960\" height=\"419\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Activision\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Real footage used in the trailer could hint at possible settings for maps and campaign battles[/caption] \n<h2>Call of Duty 2020 news, rumours and leaks</h2> \n<p>The first thing to note about Call of Duty games is that they’re made for Activision by different developers, cyclically.</p> \n<p>For instance, Infinity Ward was the studio behind last year’s Call of Duty: Modern Warfare.</p> \n<p>And this year’s game will be a Treyarch production.</p> \n<p>Treyarch was the developer behind the following games:</p> \n<ul>\n <li>Call of Duty 3</li>\n <li>Call of Duty: World at War</li>\n <li>Call of Duty: Black Ops</li>\n <li>Call of Duty: Black Ops 2</li>\n <li>Call of Duty: Black Ops 3</li>\n <li>Call of Duty: Black Ops 4</li>\n</ul> \n<p>And the studio also helped as an “assistant developer” on Modern Warfare 3, Ghosts and Infinite Warfare.</p> \n<p>We don’t know much about the game, but we do know that it’s set during the Cold War.</p> \n<p>The Cold War was a period of major tension between the USA and Soviet Union, but wasn’t an outright war in the conventional sense.</p> \n<p>Instead, both nations supported “proxy wars” – regional conflicts used to gain global influence.</p> \n<p>And the fact that both nations controlled nuclear weaponry meant that neither side was willing to risk a war proper.</p> \n<p>The period is generally said to have run from 1947 through to 1991 – when the Soviet Union was dissolved.</p> \n<p>We’ve also seen a teaser trailer that gives little away, but notes: “At the hight of the Cold War, KGB defector Yuri Bezmenov issues a chilling warning.</p> \n<p>“He claims a spy codename “Perseus” has infiltrated Western intelligence.</p> \n<p>“His goal: Suvert the US to ensure Soviet dominance in the arms race.</p> \n<p>“To this day, the identity and whereabouts of Perseus remain unknown.”</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12495453\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-67.jpeg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495453\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Activision\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Call of Duty Black Ops Cold War could be even better than the hugely popular Modern Warfare[/caption] \n<p>Bezmenov is actually a real person, and genuinely did work for the KGB.</p> \n<p>The teaser trailer uses actual footage from a real interview with Bezmenov, where he warned about the scale of the Soviet Union’s Cold War plans against the US.</p> \n<p>“Understand what’s going on around you,” he said during the interview, which was borrowed for the trailer.</p> \n<p>“You are in a state of war, and you have precious little time to save yourself.”</p> \n<p>He went on: “There’s a slow process, which we called active measures.</p> \n<p>“The first stage being demoralisation. It takes from 15 to 20 years to demoralise a nation.</p> \n<p>“The next stage is destabilisation. What matters is essentials: economy, foreign relations, defence systems.</p> \n<p>“The next stage is crisis. With the violent change of power, structure and economy, a period of normalisation.</p> \n<p>“This is what will happen in the United States if you allow the schmucks to put a Big Brother government in Washington D.C., who will promise lots of things.</p> \n<p>“Never mind if the promises are fulfilled or not.</p> \n<p>“The tomb bomb is ticking. With every second, the disaster is coming closer and closer. The danger is real.”</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12495457\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-68.jpeg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495457\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Activision\n </figcredit>\n</figure>It looks like Call of Duty’s Warzone mode will be sticking around for Black Ops Cold War[/caption] \n<p>It’s likely that the hunt for the spy Perseus will play a major role in the new Black Ops game.</p> \n<p>Activision says the game is inspired by actual events: Perseus really was the codename of a possible Soviet spy.</p> \n<p>Perseus was believed to have breached US Los Alamos during the Manhattan Project, which produced the first nuclear weapons in World War 2.</p> \n<p>What’s unique about this new Call of Duty game is that it’s dealing with a major hangover from Modern Warfare: Warzone.</p> \n<p>The incredible free-to-play Battle Royale game launched as part of Modern Warfare, but is now a hit in its own right.</p> \n<p>And it’s looking increasingly unlikely that Activision won’t be chucking it out for a new Battle Royale experience in Call of Duty 2020.</p> \n<p>Instead, it seems like Warzone will continue along in the background, potentially with updates to link it to the new game.</p> \n<p>“We’re in kind of uncharted territories here,” said Infinity Ward’s Taylor Kurosaki, speaking to GamerGen.</p> \n<p>“Call of Duty has been on a very regular cadence for many, many years.</p> \n<p>“And Warzone has made us rethink exactly how best to release new content and how to integrate it.</p> \n<p>“Call of Duty is a genre in itself: there are different branches in the Call of Duty tree, but they’re all connected in some ways.</p> \n<p>“Warzone will be the through line that connects all of the different various sub-franchises of Call of Duty.</p> \n<p>“It’s going to be really cool to see how the different sub-franchises sort of come in and out of focus, but Warzone will be the one constant.”</p> \n<!-- Start of Brightcove Player --> \n<div style=\"display: block; position: relative; min-width: 0px; max-width: 640px;\"> \n <div style=\"padding-top: 56%; \"> \n  <video data-video-id=\"6182845015001\" data-account=\"5067014667001\" data-player=\"default\" data-usage=\"cms:wordpress:5.4.2:1.7.0:javascript\" data-embed=\"default\" class=\"video-js\" controls=\"\" style=\"width: 100%; height: 100%; position: absolute; top: 0; bottom: 0; right: 0; left: 0;\"> \n  </video> \n  <script />","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 14:40:56 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-190.png?strip=all&w=960","linkMd5":"5f1953d5404448e41e92c6d44d8ea822","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn35@2020_6/2020/08/25/16-46-56-990_8b42b475eae97093.webp","destWidth":960,"destHeight":537,"sourceBytes":72672,"destBytes":72672,"author":"Sean Keach","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-190.png?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn35@2020_6/2020/08/25/16-46-56-990_8b42b475eae97093.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-191.png?strip=all&w=750":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn76@2020_6/2020/08/25/16-47-02-830_b8569ebc350f028f.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-192.png?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn8@2020_1/2020/08/25/16-47-06-632_93c2559fdbd49032.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-67.jpeg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn68@2020_2/2020/08/25/16-47-10-496_0bae90efe7805d53.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-68.jpeg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn8@2020_6/2020/08/25/16-47-01-064_802f5cbd4433aa6b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598374016696},{"createdTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"Body found in freezer taken to tip as man, 50, arrested for murder","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12495450/body-freezer-tip-man-arrested-murder/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>A MAN has been arrested on suspicion of murder after the body of an elderly man was found in a chest freezer at a tip.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Police rushed to a recycling unit in <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/where/warwickshire/\">Warwickshire</a> on Friday, August 21 after workers opened the freezer to find the corpse inside.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495712\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 838px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Colliery-Lane2.png?strip=all&#38;w=828\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495712\" width=\"828\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Police have arrested a man on suspicion of murder after a body was found in a freezer which had been taken to the tip</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496193\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604051050.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496193\" width=\"960\" height=\"449\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Google</figcredit></figure>A post-mortem will take place tomorrow, and police have asked anyone with information to get in touch[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>The appliance had been taken to the Budget Skips waste management centre in Colliery Lane, Exhall by a team who deal with house clearances.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Workers had removed it from a housing association flat in <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/where/birmingham/\">Birmingham</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The casualty has not yet been formally identified.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>A worker who opened the chest on Friday “passed out” after making the grisly discovery.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>A source said: “One of the guys got the freezer off the van and thought it seemed a bit heavy.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“When he opened it up he saw a body arched over and the spine sticking out.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“He<strong> </strong>threw up and passed out.<strong> </strong>Another of his colleagues came over and confirmed it was a body.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“With a body in the chest freezer would have been impossible to move.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;Why it was brought in without any checks astounds me.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“The guy that found the body is a lovely fella. I’m a bit cut up for him.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;It’s a horrible thing to see.” </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Other workers on the industrial estate said there had been a &#8220;terrible stench&#8221; coming from the site of Budget Skip Services for the past week.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>One man, who did not want to be named, added: &#8220;There were police and forensics crawling all over the site at the weekend.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;We&#8217;d noticed this terrible stench coming from there for about a week. It was awful, like nothing I&#8217;d ever smelled before &#8211; but we didn&#8217;t think too much of it.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;Then when this happened, it explained a lot. I really hope it wasn&#8217;t the smell of a decomposing body &#8211; but that&#8217;s what I fear it was.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;It certainly gives you the creeps to think the smell of death was in the air here.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;I don&#8217;t even want to think about it really.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Another employee company based on the estate said: &#8220;It&#8217;s like something from a mafia film and not what you&#8217;d expect to happen on an industrial estate in Coventry.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>West Midlands Police said: &#8220;We&#8217;ve launched a murder investigation after a body was found at a recycling unit in Warwickshire on Friday.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;We were made aware that a freezer &#8211; transported to a waste management centre in Colliery Lane, Exhall &#8211; had been opened and the body of an elderly man had been discovered.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;The freezer had been moved from a flat clearance by a housing association in Birmingham.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;A post-mortem examination is due to take place tomorrow, which will help identify the man.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container .rail__item-image -->\n\t\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-content\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<h3 class=\"rail__item-headline theme__copy-color\">\n\t\t\t\tSEX ATTACK\t\t\t</h3>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"rail__item-sub\">\n\t\t\t\tWoman dragged into alley and sexually attacked by 2 men who &#039;followed her home&#039;\t\t\t</span>\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail__item-content -->\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-gradient-light\">\n\n\t</div>\n\t<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12492049/woman-30s-dragged-alleyway-sexually-attacked-followed/\" class=\"rail__item-anchor\"></a>\n\n</div><!-- .rail__item .swiper-slide -->\n\t\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .swiper-wrapper -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-button-prev theme__background-color-rgba-80\"></div>\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-button-next theme__background-color-rgba-80\"></div>\n\n\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .swiper-container -->\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail .{rail} .swiper-video-rail .{theme-slug} -->\n\n\t\t</div><!-- .col .sun-col-6 -->\n\t</div><!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index-->\n\t</div> <!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;Today, a 50-year-old man, who is believed to have been known to the victim, has been arrested on suspicion of murder and taken into police custody in Derby.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Enquiries continue.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Police are urging anyone with information to contact them by calling 101 quoting log 2654 of August 21.</p>\n\n\n<div></div>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 14:38:28 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Colliery-Lane2.png?strip=all&w=828","linkMd5":"28e39991a5fee2666f7ac0f9b0809a17","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn92@2020_5/2020/08/25/16-46-59-118_f8945dde147a69d6.webp","destWidth":828,"destHeight":640,"sourceBytes":277980,"destBytes":277980,"author":"Alex Winter","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Colliery-Lane2.png?strip=all&w=828":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn92@2020_5/2020/08/25/16-46-59-118_f8945dde147a69d6.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604051050.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn48@2020_3/2020/08/25/16-47-06-978_72afee86df9dabc4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598374016698},{"createdTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"New flexible furlough rules from September 1 explained – including how much employers must pay","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/money/12496396/new-furlough-rules-september-employers-pay/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>BIG changes are coming into force next month for the millions of workers still on furlough due to the coronavirus crisis as employers will have to start contributing more cash towards the scheme. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Here&#8217;s what you need to know. </p>\n\n\n\n<p><strong><img src=\"https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/26a0.png\" alt=\"⚠\" class=\"wp-smiley\" style=\"height: 1em; max-height: 1em;\" /> Read our <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12383728/coronavirus-uk-news-deaths-live-latest-schools/\">coronavirus live blog</a> for the latest news &#38; updates</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496614\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000375174630.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496614\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty - Contributor</figcredit></figure>Employers will have to start contributing towards furloughed workers&#8217; wages from September 1[/caption]\n\n\n\n<h2>How does furlough currently work?</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>At present, furloughed workers who can&#8217;t do their jobs due to the crisis get 80% of their salaries covered by the government up to £2,500 a month. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>Until this month, the government has also covered the cost of employers&#8217; national insurance and pension contributions, although <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/money/12095199/furlough-changes-august-employers-pay-wages/\">bosses had to start coughing up for this</a> from August 1. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>This means employers are currently paying about 5% of employment costs.</p>\n\n\n\n<h2>How is furlough changing from September?</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>From September 1, the government&#8217;s contribution towards furloughed workers&#8217; wages will fall from 80% to 70%, up to a cap of £2,187.50 a month.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>This means employers will have to pay 10% of salaries to make up the rest of the 80% of wages the scheme pays, up to a cap of £2,500 a month.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>With September&#8217;s changes, employers&#8217; bills will rise to 14% of staff costs, according to the government.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<div class=\"article-boxout\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\">\n\t\t\t<h3 class=\"article-boxout__headline\">What is furlough?</h3>\n\t\t</div>\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__content theme__background-color-rgba-20\">\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<p class=\"article__content--intro\">\n\t\t\t\t\tTHE aim of the government’s job retention scheme is to save one million workers from becoming unemployed due to the coronavirus crisis.\t\t\t\t</p>\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t<div>\n<p>Under the scheme, until August 31 the&#160;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/money/11219536/upto-80-of-wages-to-be-paid-to-prevent-coronavirus-job-losses/\">government will pay 80</a>%&#160;– up to £2,500 a month – of wages of an employee who can’t work because of the impact of&#160;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/topic/coronavirus/\">coronavirus</a>.</p>\n<p>Workers will be kept on the payroll rather than being laid off.</p>\n<p>Until August 1, the government also paid the associated employer national insurance contributions and minimum automatic enrolment employer pension contributions on top, although employers have to pay these from August.</p>\n<p>The scheme has been extended to run until the end of October and can be backdated to March 1, 2020.</p>\n<p>It’s available to all employees that started a PAYE payroll scheme on or before March 19, 2020, although it closed to new entrants in June.</p>\n<p>Previous rules meant that staff couldn&#8217;t undertake any work for their employers while on furlough. </p>\n<p>But from July 1, staff members were allowed to go back part-time and they must be paid in full for the hours that they work.</p>\n<p>From September 1, employers will have to start contributing 10% of wages, with the government paying the remaining 70%. </p>\n<p>And from October 1, employers need to foot 20% of the bill, with the government making up the remaining 60%. </p>\n</div>\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>But while furloughed workers won&#8217;t actually see any change in what they&#8217;re being paid &#8211; as it&#8217;s only who&#8217;s paying that&#8217;s different &#8211; the pressure on employers to cough up more may push firms into making redundancies. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>MoneySavingExpert.com founder Martin Lewis, for example, has previously warned that employers will start making&#160;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/money/11827300/martin-lewis-warns-redundancy-furloughed-jobs/\">hundreds of thousands of people redundant</a>&#160;if they can&#8217;t afford payments.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<div class=\"article-boxout\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\">\n\t\t\t<h3 class=\"article-boxout__headline\">Can I be made redundant if I&#039;m on furlough?</h3>\n\t\t</div>\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__content theme__background-color-rgba-20\">\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<p class=\"article__content--intro\">\n\t\t\t\t\tEVEN though furlough is designed to keep workers employed, unfortunately it doesn&#039;t protect you from being made redundant.\t\t\t\t</p>\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t<div>\n<p>But it doesn&#8217;t affect your redundancy pay rights if you are let go from your job amid the&#160;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/topic/coronavirus/\">coronavirus</a>&#160;crisis.</p>\n<p>Your employer should still carry out a fair redundancy process.</p>\n<p>You will be entitled to be consulted on the redundancy lay-off first and to receive a statutory redundancy payment, as long as you&#8217;ve been working somewhere for at least two years.</p>\n<p>How much you&#8217;re entitled to depends on your age and length of service, although this is capped at 20 years. You&#8217;ll get:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Half a week’s pay for each full year you were under 22,</li>\n<li>One week’s pay for each full year you were 22 or older, but under 41,</li>\n<li>One and half week’s pay for each full year you were 41 or older.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Sadly, you won&#8217;t be entitled to a payout if you&#8217;ve been working for your employer for fewer than two years.</p>\n<p>There should be a period of collective consultation as well as time for individual ones if your employer wants to make 20 or more employees redundant within 90 days or each other.</p>\n<p>You are also entitled to appeal the decision by claiming unfair dismissal within three months of being let go.</p>\n<p>If you&#8217;re made redundant after your company has gone into administration you can claim redundancy pay <a aria-label=\"via the government (opens in a new tab)\" href=\"https://www.gov.uk/claim-redundancy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\">via Gov.uk</a>. </p>\n</div>\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\t\n\n\n\n<h2>Is furlough changing again in October?</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>Yes, furlough is changing again in October and it&#8217;s feared this will only exacerbate problems for struggling firms. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>That&#8217;s because from October 1, the government&#8217;s contribution will fall from 70% of wages to 60% of wages up to a cap of £1,875 a month.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>This will see businesses having to pay 20% of salaries to make up it up to 80% in total up to a cap of £2,500 a month.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>It means employers footing the bill for 23% of employment costs before the <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/money/11541429/furlough-scheme-end-uk-october/\">scheme ends on October 31</a> after which employers will be liable for 100% of staff costs. </p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col sun-col-6\">\n\n\t\t\t<div class=\"rail rail--classic  rail--trending theme-money\" data-slide-count=\"4\" data-slide-count-tablet=\"4\">\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-container\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"rail__header\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<h3 class=\"rail__title theme__after-color\">more on furlough</h3>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t</div>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-pagination theme__swiper-pagination\"></div>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-wrapper\">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\n<div class=\"rail__item swiper-slide\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"rail__item-image\">\n\t\t\t<a furlough scheme end?\t\t\t</span>\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail__item-content -->\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-gradient-light\">\n\n\t</div>\n\t<a -->\n\t\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-content\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<h3 class=\"rail__item-headline theme__copy-color\">\n\t\t\t\tREDUNDANCY RISK\t\t\t</h3>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"rail__item-sub\">\n\t\t\t\tOne in three businesses ‘plan on making redundancies’ by end of September\t\t\t</span>\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail__item-content -->\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-gradient-light\">\n\n\t</div>\n\t<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/money/12358747/coronavirus-redundancy-business-news/\" class=\"rail__item-anchor\"></a>\n\n</div><!-- .rail__item .swiper-slide -->\n\n<div class=\"rail__item swiper-slide\">\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"rail__item-image\">\n\t\t\t<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/money/12316561/small-businesses-run-out-of-cash/\">\n\t\t\t\t<div class=\"delayed-image-load-landscape\" data-src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000599995035.jpg?strip=all&#038;w=300&#038;h=192&#038;crop=1\"></div>\n\t\t\t\t<div class=\"delayed-image-load-mobile\" data-src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000599995035.jpg?strip=all&#038;w=300&#038;h=192&#038;crop=1\"></div>\n\t\t\t</a>\n\t\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail__item-image -->\n\t\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-content\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<h3 class=\"rail__item-headline theme__copy-color\">\n\t\t\t\tCASH CRISIS\t\t\t</h3>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"rail__item-sub\">\n\t\t\t\tSmall businesses fear they have NINE WEEKS left before they run out of cash\t\t\t</span>\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail__item-content -->\n\t<div class=\"rail__item-gradient-light\">\n\n\t</div>\n\t<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/money/12316561/small-businesses-run-out-of-cash/\" class=\"rail__item-anchor\"></a>\n\n</div><!-- .rail__item .swiper-slide -->\n\t\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .swiper-wrapper -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-button-prev theme__background-color-rgba-80\"></div>\n\t\t\t\t\t<div class=\"swiper-button-next theme__background-color-rgba-80\"></div>\n\n\t\t\t\t</div><!-- .swiper-container -->\n\t\t\t</div><!-- .rail .{rail} .swiper-video-rail .{theme-slug} -->\n\n\t\t</div><!-- .col .sun-col-6 -->\n\t</div><!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index-->\n\t</div> <!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} -->\n\t<!--googleon: all-->\n\t\n\n\n\n<p>The government hopes to combat possible redundancies with the launch of a new&#160;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/money/12064466/furlough-bonus-businesses-rishi-sunak/\">£1,000-bonus</a>&#160;for employers who take back furloughed workers and employ them continuously through to January 31, 2021.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Announced in July&#8217;s <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/politics/12063271/mini-budget-rishi-sunak-coronavirus/\">mini-Budget</a>, the £1,000 bonus will be paid by the government to bosses who take back furloughed workers and pay them at least £520 on average in each month from November to the end of January. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>As of July 1, furloughed workers are <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/money/11865841/flexible-furlough-rules-part-time-pay-calculated/\">allowed to work part-time</a> for their employer while remaining signed up to the job protection scheme. </p>\n\n\n\n\t\t<!-- Start of Brightcove Player -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div style=\"display: block; position: relative; min-width: 0px; max-width: 640px;\">\n\t\t\t\t<div style=\"padding-top: 56%; thriller makes an epic comeback on Netflix.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The crime drama, which first hit screens back in 2013 and ran for three seasons, follows DSI Stella Gibson who has been transferred from London to Belfast.</p>\n\n\n\n<ul><li><strong>The <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/11241040/best-series-to-watch-on-netflix/\">best series</a> on Netflix</strong></li><li><strong>The <a Netflix</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>This is to help catch a serial killer, (Jamie Dornan) who would find his victims in and around the city.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Viewers see him live a double life as the lovely, harmless family man with a wife and daughter, who transforms into a remorselessness, cold-blooded murderer.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>The show has found its way to the giant streaming platform and fans have taking a liking to it as it sits second on Netflix UK’s top 10 most popular programme list.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Gillian, 52, was thrilled with the news and decided to post some never-seen-before photos from her time on set.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496497\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 610px\"><img set to <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tv/12462418/the-crown-fans-sexually-confused-gillian-anderson/\">star in the new series of The Crown as Margaret Thatcher.</a></p>\n\n\n\n<p>Fans claim they’re ‘sexually confused’ by Gillian Anderson as Margaret Thatcher in the trailer for season four.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/topic/netflix/\">Netflix</a> have dropped a teaser for the upcoming fourth series and viewers may now have a crush on the actress playing the former Prime Minister.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Despite barely featuring in the clip, fans are already enamoured with the actress and couldn&#8217;t control themselves on social media.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>One fan said: &#8220;Gillian Anderson playing Margaret Thatcher is really messing up my brain&#8221;, while another penned: &#8220;Never thought I&#8217;d say this but I think I&#8217;m going to fancy Margaret Thatcher in The Crown x.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n\t\t<!-- Start of Brightcove Player -->\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<div style=\"display: block; position: relative; min-width: 0px; max-width: 640px;\">\n\t\t\t\t<div style=\"padding-top: 56%; \">\n\t\t\t\t\t<video\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tdata-video-id=\"6183287694001\" data-account=\"5067014667001\"\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tdata-player=\"default\"\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tdata-usage=\"cms:wordpress:5.4.2:1.7.0:javascript\"\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tdata-embed=\"default\" class=\"video-js\"\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\tcontrols  \t\t\t\t\t\t\tstyle=\"width: 100%; height: 100%; position: absolute; top: 0; bottom: 0; right: 0; left: 0;\">\n\t\t\t\t\t</video>\n\n\t\t\t\t\t<script src=\"https://players.brightcove.net/5067014667001/default_default/index.min.js\"></script>\n\t\t\t\t</div>\n\t\t\t</div>\n\n\t\t\n\t\t<!-- End of Brightcove Player -->\n\n\t\t\n\n\n<div></div>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 16:25:18 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/EgMPnSXXoAA70FV.jpg?strip=all&w=479","linkMd5":"5cc74fc29ef0393e73d818b8768927c7","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn95@2020_3/2020/08/25/16-46-57-151_c70a060723ba5cae.webp","destWidth":479,"destHeight":639,"sourceBytes":26604,"destBytes":26604,"author":"Liam Llewellyn","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/EgMPnSXXoAA70FV.jpg?strip=all&w=479":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn95@2020_3/2020/08/25/16-46-57-151_c70a060723ba5cae.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/EgMPnSWWsAEqkep.jpg?strip=all&w=600":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn39@2020_1/2020/08/25/16-47-01-393_6b74a7a5574610c2.webp","https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/1f389.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn19@2020_2/2020/08/25/16-47-05-291_d7367da6e898aef2.webp","https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/12.0.0-1/72x72/1f609.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn100@2020_3/2020/08/25/16-47-05-468_80ba72b7642bafbb.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/EgMPnSVXgAAU2xX-1.jpg?strip=all&w=462":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn11@2020_2/2020/08/25/16-47-10-901_d15aef1abff0b78d.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/EgMPnSXXsAAfeO3-1.jpg?strip=all&w=402":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn72@2020_5/2020/08/25/16-47-08-356_1b850478c50b67be.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598374016657},{"createdTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"How to listen to PRIVATE conversations your Alexa has quietly recorded and saved","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/12495981/amazon-alexa-recordings-private-conversations-save-delete/","description":"<p>AMAZON records everything you say to your Alexa speaker – and sometimes picks up extra conversations too.</p> \n<p>Sometimes Amazon workers will listen in to these audio clips, so we reveal how to find them – and then delete them.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12496230\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-69.jpeg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496230\" width=\"960\" height=\"640\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  Alamy\n </figcredit>\n</figure>Alexa sometimes listens in to your conversations – and you can hear what she’s recorded[/caption] \n<p>Earlier this year, an ex-Amazon exec&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/10981326/amazon-alexa-spying-listening-bbc-panorama/\">admitted that he turns his Alexa off</a>&nbsp;to stop strangers listening in on his conversations.</p> \n<p>That’s because Amazon was sometimes sending your voice clips off to “graders”.</p> \n<p>These workers will listen to clips to make sure Alexa is working as intended – improving the system all round.</p> \n<p>However, Alexa will sometimes record you without your knowledge, because she thought you said her name.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12496233\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 475px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-70.jpeg?strip=all&amp;w=465\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496233\" width=\"465\" height=\"960\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  The Sun / Amazon\n </figcredit>\n</figure>You can play back your entire history of Alexa recordings[/caption] \n<p>Here’s what you need to do…</p> \n<h2>How to find Alexa voice recordings</h2> \n<p>First, open the Alexa app on your smartphone or tablet.</p> \n<p>Tap into the menu bar on the left-hand side and then tap Settings.</p> \n<p>Next tap Alexa Privacy, and then go into Review Voice History.</p> \n<p>This is where you can check up on all of the voice recordings Alexa has captured for you.</p> \n<p>To listen to the Alexa recordings, simply tap the text you want to hear, and then click the tiny Play icon.</p> \n<p>Sometimes Alexa will flag when it thinks an audio recording wasn’t intended her.</p> \n<p>The text won’t display in that instance, but you can still listen to the audio file.</p> \n<h2>How to delete Alexa voice recordings</h2> \n<p>To delete audio recordings, individually tap on the empty boxes next to each recording to “tick” them.</p> \n<p>Then go to the top of the list and press “Delete Selected Recordings” to delete those individual files.</p> \n<p>You can also select a date range like “Today”, “This Week” or “All History” and then press “Delete All Recordings” for that date range.</p> \n<p>If you just want to delete recordings for a specific speaker, you can tap Filter By Device and choose the exact Alexa gadget you’re looking for.</p> \n<p>You can also enable deletion by voice on this page.</p> \n<p>If you toggle it on, you can delete recordings using voice commands.</p> \n<p>Just say either “Alexa, delete what I just said” or “Alexa, delete everything I said today”.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12496239\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-71.jpeg?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496239\" width=\"960\" height=\"906\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  The Sun / Amazon\n </figcredit>\n</figure>It’s really easy to delete Alexa recordings for all of your devices[/caption] \n<h2>Should you delete Alexa voice recordings?</h2> \n<p>You should be rightly worried about Amazon storing a giant log of your voice recordings.</p> \n<p>Major social media firms have suffered hacks and leaks, so you’re never truly safe.</p> \n<p>But deleting your voice recordings isn’t always the best idea.</p> \n<p>Though deletion will boost your privacy, it may make your experience with Alexa worse.</p> \n<p>Alexa learns your voice and habits over time to improve the service.</p> \n<p>By removing all of your voice recordings, you undo a lot of that learning.</p> \n<p>That said, Alexa will still function just fine even if she’s not saving everything you say.</p> \n<p>The choice is yours: do you want maximum privacy or the best service?</p> \n<!-- Start of Brightcove Player --> \n<div style=\"display: block; position: relative; min-width: 0px; max-width: 640px;\"> \n <div style=\"padding-top: 56%; controls=\"\" style=\"width: 100%; height: 100%; position: absolute; top: 0; bottom: 0; right: 0; left: 0;\"> \n  </video> \n  <script <!-- .col .sun-col-6 --> \n </div>\n <!-- .sun-row .{row} .rail-video-index--> \n</div> \n<!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} --> \n<!--googleon: all--> \n<p>In other news, find out how to&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/10981322/is-amazon-alexa-spying-how-to-stop-listening/\">stop strangers from listening to your Alexa audio</a>.</p> \n<p>We reveal the&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/10611128/best-alexa-skills-tips-tricks-amazon-echo-speaker/\">best Alexa tips and tricks</a>.</p> \n<p>A terrified mum says her Amazon Echo speaker&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/10585452/mum-amazon-echo-speaker-kill-herself/\">urged her to kill herself</a>.</p> \n<p>And Amazon recently launched&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/10005674/amazon-alexa-speakers-samuel-l-jackson-echo/\">an Alexa ring and a smart oven</a>.</p> \n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" /> \n<p><strong>We pay for your stories! Email us at <a href=\"mailto:tech@thesun.co.uk\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">tech@the-sun.co.uk</a></strong></p> \n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 15:35:02 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-69.jpeg?strip=all&w=960","linkMd5":"771fd7cc47c4fcc946c9937101e299d3","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn7@2020_5/2020/08/25/16-46-56-994_bdc52176fa94f35f.webp","destWidth":960,"destHeight":640,"sourceBytes":10788,"destBytes":10788,"author":"Sean Keach","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-69.jpeg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn7@2020_5/2020/08/25/16-46-56-994_bdc52176fa94f35f.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-70.jpeg?strip=all&w=465":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn96@2020_4/2020/08/25/16-47-07-409_c14cd3cc0da088ac.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/image-71.jpeg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn27@2020_2/2020/08/25/16-47-04-339_47bbe5f41c4b1497.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598374016705},{"createdTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"US Air Force reveals ‘flying battle car’ that will shuttle troops across war zones – and it looks ridiculous","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/12493606/us-air-force-flying-battle-car/","description":"<p>PHOTOS of a bonkers “flying car” that could one day ferry soldiers across the battlefield have been shared by the US Air Force.</p> \n<p>The images capture a demo of the single-seat machine, which takes off using 18 small propellers, at a military camp in Texas last week.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12494837\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/AA-2.png?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12494837\" width=\"960\" height=\"960\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  US Air Force\n </figcredit>\n</figure>The US Air Force has shared photos of a bonkers flying car[/caption] \n<p>The US military has previously said it wants a fleet of 30 flying cars in the Air Force by 2030.</p> \n<p>The aircraft piloted during the August 20 demo at Camp Mabry in Austin is an electric vertical take-off and landing vehicle (eVTOL).</p> \n<p>Flown under the Air Force’s Agility Prime programme, they’re tiny, manned machines that liftoff vertically under rotor blades – like a helicopter.</p> \n<p>Among other things, the high-tech craft could one day be used to speedily shuttle troops and equipment across war zones.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12494844\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/CC.png?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12494844\" width=\"960\" height=\"639\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  US Air Force\n </figcredit>\n</figure>A demo was carried out at Camp Mabry in Austin last week[/caption] \n<p>“The thought of an electric vertical take-off and landing vehicle – a flying car – might seem straight out of a Hollywood movie,” Air Force Secretary Barbara Barrett said.</p> \n<p>“But by partnering today with stakeholders across industries and agencies, we can set up the United States for this aerospace phenomenon.”</p> \n<p>The “Hexa” aircraft was built by Texas eVTOL startup, LIFT Aircraft. It seats one passenger and takes off from a standstill, like a large drone.</p> \n<p>The flying car can even float on water, according to LIFT, using the six buoyant feet around its perimeter.</p> \n<figure id=\"attachment_12494852\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\">\n <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/BB.png?strip=all&amp;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12494852\" width=\"960\" height=\"638\" />\n <figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption>\n <figcredit>\n  US Air Force\n </figcredit>\n</figure>The US military has previously said it wants a fleet of 30 flying cars in the Air Force by 2030[/caption] \n<p>Riders – who do not need a pilots license to operate the contraption – steer it using a simple, three-axis joystick.</p> \n<p>A “triply redundant autopilot computer” takes care of the rest, according to LIFT’s website.</p> \n<p>In a <a href=\"https://www.af.mil/News/Article-Display/Article/2321614/air-force-top-leaders-witness-first-agility-prime-flying-car-demo/\">blog post</a> detailing the demo, Agility Prime boss Col. Nathan Diller said the recent flight marked the first of many demonstrations</p> \n<p>It’s part of a wider US plan to get flying cars into operation within the next decade.</p> \n<div class=\"article-boxout\"> \n <div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\"> \n  <h3 class=\"article-boxout__headline\">Terrifying space weapons of the future</h3> \n </div> \n <div class=\"article-boxout__content theme__background-color-rgba-20\"> \n  <div class=\"article-boxout__content-img\"> \n   <img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/space-war-NEW2.jpg?strip=all&amp;&amp;w=620&amp;&amp;h=413&amp;&amp;crop=1\" width=\"620\" height=\"413\" /> \n  </div> \n  <p class=\"article__content--intro\"> Here are three of the scariest... </p> \n  <div> \n   <p><strong>Rods from God</strong></p> \n   <ul> \n    <li>A strange but utterly terrifying weapon has been dubbed “rods from the God” and is based on the concept of creating man-made meteorites that can be guided towards the enemy.</li> \n    <li>Instead of using rocks rods the size of telephone poles are deployed.</li> \n    <li>These would be made out of tungsten — a rare metal that can stand the intense heat generated by entering Earth’s atmosphere.</li> \n    <li>One satellite fires the rods towards the Earth’s atmosphere while the other steers them to a target on the ground.</li> \n    <li>Reaching speeds of 7000mph they hit the ground with the force of a small nuclear weapon&nbsp;— but crucially creating no radiation fall out.</li> \n    <li>As bizarre as it sounds, a US Congressional report recently revealed the military has been pushing ahead with the kinetic space weapons.</li> \n   </ul> \n   <p><strong>Molten metal cannons</strong></p> \n   <ul> \n    <li>This intriguing idea is being developed by the&nbsp;US Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA).</li> \n    <li>It is called the Magneto Hydrodynamic Explosive Munition or MAHEM.</li> \n    <li>This game changing rail-gun can fire a jet of molten metal, hurled through space at several hundred miles per second by the most powerful electromagnets ever built.</li> \n    <li>The molten metal can then morph into an aerodynamic slug during flight and pierce through another spacecraft or satellite and a munition explodes inside.</li> \n   </ul> \n   <p><strong>Space force ships</strong></p> \n   <ul> \n    <li>Already the United States is powering head with its spacecraft, although China is busy developing one of their own.</li> \n    <li>The top secret American XS-1 under development by DARPA.</li> \n    <li>It can travel ten times the speed of sound and launch missiles.</li> \n    <li>Meanwhile an&nbsp;unmanned craft is currently being developed in the China Aerodynamics Research and Development Centre in Mianyang, Sichuan province, which is also known as Base 29.</li> \n   </ul> \n  </div> \n </div> \n</div> \n<p>Earlier this year, the US Air Force’s Will Roper revealed plans to build a whole fleet of flying cars.</p> \n<p>“We want to have 30 vehicles in the Air Force by 2030,” Roper told reporters during a video call in April, according to <a href=\"https://www.military.com/daily-news/2020/04/30/air-force-wants-30-flying-cars-next-10-years.html\">Military.com</a>.</p> \n<p>A number of firms are racing to develop the world’s first eVTOL okayed for public flights, primarily with the goal of launching flying taxi services.</p> \n<p>Uber, for instance, is developing a <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/9272127/uber-air-flying-taxi-cabins-skyports-launch-date/\">space-age cab</a> that will jet passengers between “Skyports” in Dallas and Los Angeles from 2023.</p> .rail-video-index--> \n</div> \n<!-- .sun-grid-container .sun-grid-container--{color} --> \n<!--googleon: all--> \n<p>In other new, the US recently tested&nbsp;<a has unveiled plans&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/12299160/virgin-galactic-jet-passengers/\">for a new super-jet</a>&nbsp;that could whisk passengers from London to New York in 90 minutes.</p> \n<p>And, billionaire Sir Richard Branson&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tech/12306187/branson-musk-bezos-space-race-virgin-galactic-flight/\">will rocket into space aboard</a>&nbsp;a Virgin Galactic spaceship next year, the company has announced.</p> \n<p>What are your thoughts on the hypersonic jet? 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"Ex-Barcelona president Laporta believes club WANT to sell Messi and says axing Suarez is ‘an act of cowardice’","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12495244/barcelona-messi-suarez-laporta-transfer-blast/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p><strong>BARCELONA want to sell star man Lionel Messi this summer.</strong></p>\n\n\n\n<p>That’s according to ex-president Joan Laporta, who has also branded the club’s axing of Luis Suarez as an “act of cowardice.”</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495868\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000601984584.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495868\" width=\"960\" height=\"656\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>AP:Associated Press</figcredit></figure>Ex-president Joan Laporta says Barcelona want to sell Lionel Messi[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Barcelona are in turmoil after sacking Quique Setien in the wake of their 8-2 Champions League defeat to Bayern Munich.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Ronald Koeman has been brought in to steady the ship.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But it’s reckoned he’s ready to cut a number of big names aside in his quest to restore normality to the Nou Camp.</p>\n\n\n\n<div class=\"wp-block-group\"><div class=\"wp-block-group__inner-container\">\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n\n\n\n<h2><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12371286/transfer-news-live-winks-man-city-cristiano-ronaldo-barcelona-spurs-liverpool/\">TRANSFER NEWS LIVE: Breaking news, juicy gossip and the biggest deals</a></h2>\n\n\n\n<hr class=\"wp-block-separator\" />\n</div></div>\n\n\n\n<p>Barcelona legend Messi, 33, has been tipped to move on after entering the final year of his contract.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12495085/lionel-messi-future-transfer-reveal-barcelona/\">Manchester City are believed to be keen</a> on the Argentine forward.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And there is <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12490730/inter-milan-lionel-messi-transfer-barcelona-owner/\">strong interest from Inter Milan</a> as well.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12495869\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603110180-3.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12495869\" width=\"960\" height=\"628\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>Laporta has slammed Barca&#8217;s treatment of Luis Suarez[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Meanwhile, ex-Liverpool star Suarez, 33, has reportedly been told by Koeman <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/12493771/premier-league-koeman-barcelona-rakitic-umtiti-vidal-suarez/\">he will be sold this summer</a>.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>There are believed to be a <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/12493371/luis-suarez-premier-league-barcelona-ajax/\">number of Premier League clubs in the hunt</a>, with former side Ajax and David Beckham’s Inter Miami also involved.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Laporta, who helped establish Barca as Europe’s top side between 2003 and 2010, has now laid into the current “incompetent” hierarchy as he prepares a bid for office again.</p>\n\n\n\n<a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/RR-SPORTS-GRAPHIC-BARCA-v5.jpg\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/RR-SPORTS-GRAPHIC-BARCA-v5.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=408\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12450446\" width=\"408\" height=\"960\" /></a>\n\n\n\n<p>He reckons, contrary to reports in Spain, that Barcelona ARE plotting to sell fan favourite Messi.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And Laporta also believes Suarez has been treated extremely poorly after some incredible years of service to the club.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Laporta tweeted: “They have told Suarez they don’t want him by telephone.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: Chapman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000601984584.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn56@2020_5/2020/08/25/16-46-56-985_48d4715832138288.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603110180-3.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn29@2020_2/2020/08/25/16-47-01-892_5de7f0d270884f9b.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/RR-SPORTS-GRAPHIC-BARCA-v5.jpg?strip=all&w=408":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn47@2020_5/2020/08/25/16-47-09-961_3c1100b973f7b1b7.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000582509068.jpg?strip=all&w=960":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn7@2020_2/2020/08/25/16-47-12-537_65006cdbf9e1007f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598374016701},{"createdTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"EastEnders: Who is Mica Paris and who will she play?","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tv/12496104/eastenders-mica-paris-new-character-ellie-nixon/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>EASTENDERS has cast British singer Mica Paris as a new character set to cause a stir in Walford.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tv/12457665/eastenders-sign-up-mica-paris\">The London-born soul star will appear in September</a> when <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/11887743/eastenders-off-air-return-september/\">the BBC One soap</a> returns as the ‘formidable’ Ellie Nixon &#8211; who has a shock connection with an Albert Square resident. Here’s the lowdown&#8230;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496241\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 650px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603252948-2.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=640\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496241\" width=\"640\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">EastEnders has cast soul singer Mica Paris as new character Ellie Nixon</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<h2>Who is Mica Paris?</h2>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/4904115/mica-paris-songs-ex-husband-children/\">Mica Paris</a> is best known for her singing career with a number of Top 10 singles, such as My Temptation and Where Is The Love.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>In addition to racking up seven albums, Mica, 51, has also appeared in musicals including Fame, Chicago and Love Me Tender.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Mica has also turned her hand to presenting on both the radio and TV over the years, and co-hosted BBC&#8217;s What Not To Wear.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Speaking about joining the soap, she said: “I am absolutely over the moon to be in EastEnders.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;I have been a fan since its first episode with Susan Tully being my favourite.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“My character the formidable Ellie Nixon, is a new frontier for me as an actress &#8211; a lot of folks will see me as never before.”</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Jon Sen, executive producer of EastEnders, added: &#8220;We&#8217;re thrilled to welcome Mica Paris to the world of Walford to play tough, no-nonsense Ellie Nixon.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;Ellie proves herself to be a ruthless and uncompromising force of nature who stops at nothing to ensure she capitalises on whatever she can.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;The part demanded both charisma and presence and having seen Mica on stage, she was the first person who came to mind for this role. We can&#8217;t wait for the audience to meet Ellie and the mystery that surrounds her.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496259\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 656px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603076011-1.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=646\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496259\" width=\"646\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Getty Images - Getty</figcredit></figure>New EastEnders cast member Mica Paris has a number of Top 10 singles[/caption]\n\n\n\n<h2>Who will Mica Paris play in EastEnders?</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>Mica Paris will join the cast of EastEnders as Ellie Nixon, someone with connections in Walford who’s ready to ruffle some feathers.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Ellie is described by the BBC series as &#8220;a wolf in sheep&#8217;s clothing, with far more to her than her warm-hearted facade lets on.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;With a surprising connection to Walford residents, her prowess for playing roles in order to get what she wants isn&#8217;t to be underestimated.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div class=\"col Ellie Nixon&#8217;s arrival storyline in EastEnders be?</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>EastEnders are yet to confirm what Ellie&#8217;s new storyline will be when the soap returns to our screens in September. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>But a source teased: “EastEnders wants to return with a bang following lockdown and Mica will certainly supply the spark.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“Her character is fiery and passionate and will take no prisoners.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>“Walford won’t know what’s hit it.”</p>\n\n\n<div></div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 16:02:50 +0000","feedId":10019,"bgimg":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603252948-2.jpg?strip=all&w=640","linkMd5":"c8927c2dedcd32a6ca73cd4f0146e617","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn36@2020_4/2020/08/25/16-46-58-138_60eed201f50a006f.webp","destWidth":640,"destHeight":959,"sourceBytes":188024,"destBytes":188024,"author":"Molly Moss","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603252948-2.jpg?strip=all&w=640":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn36@2020_4/2020/08/25/16-46-58-138_60eed201f50a006f.webp","https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000603076011-1.jpg?strip=all&w=646":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn44@2020_4/2020/08/25/16-47-10-265_6a03fb0693d184cd.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598374016682},{"createdTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"The Walking Dead fans stunned as they spot ‘endless zombie loop’ easter egg spanning 15 years","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tv/12495367/the-walking-dead-fans-stunned-as-they-spot-endless-zombie-loop-easter-egg-spanning-15-years/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>THE Walking Dead has impressed fans with an easter egg 15 years in the making.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>As fans will know, the AMC zombie drama is based upon the comics by Robert Kirkman, with the scripts broadly following the stories laid out the by author, with a few notable exceptions.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12269549\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 650px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/RickDaryl.png?strip=all&#38;w=640\" alt=\"The Walking Dead\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12269549\" width=\"640\" height=\"369\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Rick and Daryl are two of the show&#8217;s most popular characters</figcaption><figcredit>AMC</figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>The comics drew to a close last year, leaving many worried about the future of the show, although execs were quick to point out that the it could well outlive the graphic novels.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>In the first issue, a horde of zombies are seen reaching outwards, with the figure on the far left of the cover completely cut out, aside from an ear.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>However, now fans have noticed an impressive feat of continuity pulled off by Kirkman on the covers of his first and last comic issues.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>It turns out that the zombie group featured on the last cover join up perfectly with this image if laid side, with the ear becoming part of the largest zombie head.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_undefined\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 10px\"><img src=\"https://i2.wp.com/metro.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/PRI_162128280.jpg?quality=90&#38;strip=all&#38;zoom=1&#38;resize=540%2C521&#38;ssl=1\" alt=\"The Walking Dead\" class=\"alignnone\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">The first and last comics form one eerie image</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n<p>One fan was so impressed with the gesture that he tweeted <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/10368188/the-walking-dead-end-season-12-robert-kirkman-comics/\">Robert Kirkman</a> to congratulate him.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>He captioned the picture: &#8220;Oh my God you inspired me to check if the last volume loops back into the first volume and it DOES!</p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;It is an endless zombie loop spanning 15 years of art!! @RobertKirkman am I the first to discover this?!&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Kirkman confirmed that he&#8217;d been eagerly waiting for someone to point the easter egg out.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12249271\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/walking-dead-world-beyond.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12249271\" width=\"960\" height=\"540\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">The Walking Dead is famed for its impressive prosthetics</figcaption><figcredit></figcredit></figure>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container sun-grid-container--white\">\n\t\n\t<div class=\"sun-row \">\n\t\t<div &#8220;You may actually be the first to notice this. I was always wondering when someone would. Nice work!&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>It wasn&#8217;t long before other fans come forward with their own theories in the comments section about the signifcance of the image.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>One pointed out that every single cover featuring a row of zombies matched up when placed alongside each other. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>&#8220;So it’s not a &#8216;line&#8217; of Walkers…it’s a circle… We’re surrounded,&#8221; one wrote.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<div class=\"article-boxout\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\">\n\t\t\t<h3 class=\"article-boxout__headline\">What&#039;s on Netflix and Amazon Prime?</h3>\n\t\t</div>\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__content theme__background-color-rgba-20\">\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<p class=\"article__content--intro\">\n\t\t\t\t\tLooking for a new Netflix series to binge or the best movies to watch on Amazon Prime? And I thought your coloured re-release was evil… this is next level!!&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Meanwhile a third noticed that the pair of zombies on the cover resemble Kirkman and artist partner-in-crime Charlie Adlard. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>The duo have worked on the series for almost two decades, so what better way to conmemorate their bromance?</p>\n\n\n\n<p>At the time the comics were cancelled, <a 00:46:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-26 00:46:56","title":"Tuesday Racing: Tips, news, betting and all the latest for Yarmouth, Catterick and Bangor today","link":"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/horseracing/12487016/tuesday-racing-tips-betting-yarmouth-catterick-bangor-today/","description":"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<p>YOU really have to be a racing anorak to get excited by Tuesday&#8217;s offering on course.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Catterick and Yarmouth provide the entertainment on the Flat and the summer jumping continues at Bangor. It&#8217;s relatively uninspiring stuff, but it keeps the show on the road.</p>\n\n\n\n<img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/sun-racing-grop-33-Recovered-2.png?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12487537\" width=\"960\" height=\"540\" />\n\n\n\n<p>There are some big guns out at <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/horseracing/racecards/2020-08-25/yarmouth/15:20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Yarmouth</a> and away from the handicaps there may be one or two races to note.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Being so close to Newmarket a few of the fair-weather jockeys don&#8217;t mind the short drive.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/horseracing/racecards/2020-08-25/catterick/12:50\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Catterick&#8217;s card</a> looked a punting nightmare. Plenty of low-grade handicaps mean it was hard work, but there was one bet I found, albeit a rather unoriginal one.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Bangor keeps the tweed brigade chirpy &#8211; <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/horseracing/racecards/2020-08-25/bangor-on-dee/13:00\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">with a pair of 0-130s technically the best races of the day</a>. Nicky Henderson and Nico De Boinville are even set to make an appearance.</p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<h3>Tuesday&#8217;s Bets</h3>\n\n\n\n<p>Completing a Rubik&#8217;s cube whilst blindfolded may have been simply than some of the handicaps on offer on Tuesday.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But up at Catterick one horse sticks out as a bet, with Ralph Beckett&#8217;s yard back in good nick.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>And <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/horseracing/racecards/2020-08-25/catterick/14:55\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">DEFT (2.55 Catterick)</a> looks to have been found a nice opening on her handicap bow.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She&#8217;s been a slow burner &#8211; a very slow one &#8211; but showed more at Newbury last time, when finishing well from off the pace in what looked an above average novice.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>A mark of 72 looks fair enough on that run alone and it may have been a few pounds higher had she not been so quiet at Kempton and Windsor.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Now Beckett isn&#8217;t one to rush his horses and why she is unlikely to be anything to write home about in time, her pedigree suggests she should be kicking on from this level in the near future.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She&#8217;s a half-sister to the yard&#8217;s Oaks winner Talent and runs in the same colours.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Up in trip again, she is just about backable with David O&#8217;Meara&#8217;s <strong>Golden Hind</strong> sure to be popular. Bigger prices were quickly chopped up, but she should be better than these.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>On a miserable day, she&#8217;s all we can muster &#8211; but a winner, is a winner.</p>\n\n\n\n<iframe class=\"authenticated-iframe\" src=\"https://fragments.sunracingtech.uk/best_price?horse=deft&#038;date=2020-08-25&#038;time=14:55&#038;course=catterick\" height=\"150\" width=\"100%\" frameborder=\"0\" style=\"height: 150px;\"></iframe>\n\n\n\n\t<div class=\"article-boxout\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\">\n\t\t\t<h3 class=\"article-boxout__headline\">Tuesday Bets</h3>\n\t\t</div>\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__content theme__background-color-rgba-20\">\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t\n\t\t\t<div>\n<p><strong>DEFT</strong>&#8211; 2pt win 11-4 (Betfair, Paddy Power)</p>\n<p>Rolling P&#38;L: -2.90</p>\n</div>\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\t\n\n\n\n<h3>Be there, or be square</h3>\n\n\n\n<p>A couple of the heats are of potential long-term interest at Yarmouth, and none more so than the <a href=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/horseracing/racecards/2020-08-25/yarmouth/18:30\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Fillies&#8217; Novice (6.30)</a> over a mile.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>John Gosden has a good record at the track and he&#8217;s run a few smart ones down the years at the seaside track. <strong>Mostly</strong> has a way to go yet but could be yet another promising filly for the yard &#8211; she&#8217;ll be hard to beat here.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She&#8217;s closely related to the yard&#8217;s Group 1 winner Journey and should defy a  penalty here.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>But she faces a few nicely bred types &#8211; the Hamdan pair of <strong>Jaariyah</strong> and <strong>Areehaa</strong> particularly.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>For a quiet day, this looks an above average novice &#8211; on paper anyway.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<div class=\"article-boxout\">\n\t\t<div class=\"article-boxout__header theme__background-color\">\n\t\t\t<h3 class=\"article-boxout__headline\">Going Good</p>\n<p>Catterick &#8211; Soft</p>\n</div>\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\t\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 25 Aug 2020 15:02:00 familiar to avid medical documentary fans. </p>\n\n\n\n<p>The Trust Me I’m A Doctor presenter of says she is &#8220;passionate about social justice and health equity&#8221; and is trying to make healthcare accessible to everyone. </p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496868\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 410px\"><img height=\"400\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Twitter</figcredit></figure>Dr Guddi Singh says she is &#8216;passionate about social justice and health equity&#8217;[/caption]\n\n\n\n<h2>Who is Dr Guddi Singh?</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>Paediatrician Dr Guddi Singh is an Integrated Child Health Quality Improvement Fellow and a Paediatric Registrar at East London NHS Foundation Trust.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She is also on the Executive Management Team of the Centre for Health and the Public Interest.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Guddi has a Masters in Public Health from Harvard University.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She has previously worked for the World Health Organization.</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496965\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 650px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000604061712.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=640\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496965\" width=\"640\" height=\"960\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>BBC</figcredit></figure>Guddi has a Masters in Public Health from Harvard University.[/caption]\n\n\n\n<p>Dr Singh is currently Advocacy lead for the British Association for Child and Adolescent Health and co-manages the health think-tank, the Centre for Health and the Public Interest.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Guddi&#8217;s websites states that she &#8220;is keen to &#8216;humanise&#8221; healthcare and is now researching what the social dimensions of disease and illness might mean for 21st century medicine in her PhD.&#8221;</p>\n\n\n\n<figure id=\"attachment_12496875\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\" style=\"width: 970px\"><img src=\"https://www.thesun.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/NINTCHDBPICT000451956110.jpg?strip=all&#38;w=960\" alt=\"\" class=\"alignnone size-thesun-article-image wp-image-12496875\" width=\"960\" height=\"632\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\"></figcaption><figcredit>Voltage TV Productions</figcredit></figure>Singh&#8217;s first TV gig was on BBC Two’s &#8216;Babies: Their Wonderful World&#8217;[/caption]\n\n\n\n<h2>What TV shows has <strong>Dr Guddi Singh</strong> appeared on?</h2>\n\n\n\n<p>Guddi is one of the presenters on BBC Two’s “Trust Me I’m A Doctor”.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She also co-hosted the BBC Two Horizon coronavirus special in 2020.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>Her first TV gig was on BBC Two’s “Babies: Their Wonderful World” &#8211; the largest study on early child development ever attempted.</p>\n\n\n\n<p>She has since appeared on BBC Two’s Trust Me I’m A Doctor and Al-Jazeera’s The Cure.</p>\n\n\n\n\t<!--googleoff: all-->\n\t\t<div class=\"sun-grid-container So @18Birdiesapp came out with this really awesome tool to help you work on your golf swing and improve your game! It&#39;s called the AI Coach, and you can use it anywhere, so it&#39;s perfect for practicing at home (like in the garage!) or range or where you have some space to swing! All you need to do is download 18Birdies and use the new AI Coach tool.  Analyze your swing using the AI Coach and share your swing video (with the AI Coach graphics) by posting it to Instagram and tagging me and @18birdiesapp and hashtag #PlayBetterGolf. I’ll choose 5 winners to get a 1 on 1 virtual coaching session with me or a lesson plan using your results from the AI Coach where we can chat about golf, life, and I’ll try not to roast your swing too bad!  Plus, one lucky winner out of the 5 will win a custom fitting from @ClubChampion! Let’s get you in shape to play your best golf when you get back out on the course. Link in bio to download!</a></p> <p style=\" color:#c9c8cd; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px; margin-bottom:0; margin-top:8px; overflow:hidden; padding:8px 0 7px;
